This event will consist of 2 different sessions. Sessions start at 12pm, 2pm and 4pm. Go to one, or both!

Workshop Description:

Starting with a brief description of all the major constant and strobe lighting options available to you and ending with a hands-on demonstration that will get you started in portrait and product photography (or video). This is both a great primer for those new to lighting and a refresher for those who have some experience in the field.  

Adorama will walk through the various types of continuous lights for both filmmakers and still shooters including Tungsten, LED, Fluorescent and show brands in all price points, as well as talk about the pros and cons of flash for still photographers and studio versus small flash set-ups.

LEARN: What type of lights will give you the most bang for your buck

LEARN: When to use different types of lights and how to mix them

LEARN: What is the difference between an umbrella and a softbox, or beauty dish?

LEARN: What is sync speed and flash duration?

LEARN: Five must-have pieces of grip

The same information is covered in each session. This event will consist of 3 different sessions. Sessions start at 12pm, 2pm and 4pm.

results.description:
This is a webcast - https://www.brighttalk.com/webcast/13685/194115

Apache Apex is an open source stream processing and next generation analytics platform incubating at the Apache Software Foundation. Apex is a next generation native Hadoop platform and was built from ground up for scalability, low-latency processing, high availability and operability. 

In this webinar you will learn about Apache Apex fault tolerance, high availability and processing guarantees.

From the users perspective, fault tolerance of a stream processing platform should cover the state of the application/processor and the in-flight data. In the event of failure, the platform should recover, restore state and resume processing with no loss of data. We will cover:

- Components of an Apex application and how they are made fault tolerant

- How native YARN support is leveraged for fault tolerance

- How operator checkpointing works and how the user can tune it

- Failure scenarios, recovery from failures, incremental recovery

- Processing guarantees and which option is appropriate for your application

- Sample topology for highly available, low latency real-time processing

- How is fault-tolerance in Apex different from similar platforms such as Storm, Spark Streaming and Flink

Presenter: Thomas Weise - A Hadoop veteran, and PPMC member Apache Apex
results.how_to_find_us: It is an online Webcast
results.name: Fault Tolerance and Processing Semantics with Apache Apex

Apache Apex is an open source stream processing and next generation analytics platform incubating at the Apache Software Foundation. Apex is a next generation native Hadoop platform and was built from ground up for scalability, low-latency processing, high availability and operability. 

In this webinar you will learn about Apache Apex fault tolerance, high availability and processing guarantees.

From the users perspective, fault tolerance of a stream processing platform should cover the state of the application/processor and the in-flight data. In the event of failure, the platform should recover, restore state and resume processing with no loss of data. We will cover:

- Components of an Apex application and how they are made fault tolerant

- How native YARN support is leveraged for fault tolerance

- How operator checkpointing works and how the user can tune it

- Failure scenarios, recovery from failures, incremental recovery

- Processing guarantees and which option is appropriate for your application

- Sample topology for highly available, low latency real-time processing

- How is fault-tolerance in Apex different from similar platforms such as Storm, Spark Streaming and Flink

Presenter: Thomas Weise - A Hadoop veteran, and PPMC member Apache Apex
results.how_to_find_us: It is an online Webcast
results.name: Fault Tolerance and Processing Semantics with Apache Apex

group.name: Big Data (native Hadoop) Ingest and Transform, New York

results.description:
Get Started in Photo/Video

Lighting in 90 Minutes!

Join Daniel Norton for an intensive 90 minute lecture covering everything you wanted to know about lighting but were afraid to ask.

Starting with a brief description of all the major constant and strobe lighting options available to you and ending with a hands-on demonstration that will get you started in portrait and product photography (or video). This is both a great primer for those new to lighting and a refresher for those who have some experience in the field.  

We will walk through the various types of continuous lights for both filmmakers and still shooters including Tungsten, LED, Fluorescent and show brands in all price points, as well as talk about the pros and cons of flash for still photographers and studio versus small flash set-ups.

Everything you wanted to know about photographic lighting, broken down in a simple overview, complete with examples and live demos.  

LEARN: What type of lights will give you the most bang for your buck

LEARN: When to use different types of lights and how to mix them

LEARN: What is the difference between an umbrella and a softbox, or beauty dish?

LEARN: What is sync speed and flash duration?

LEARN: Five must-have pieces of grip


Demos Start at 12, 2 and 4:30pm.

The same information is covered in each session.

Daniel Norton is the Creative Director of Adorama with over 15 years experience as a Photographer, Director and DP in the advertising and editorial markets. Daniel also produces and hosts FREE weekly in-store trainings for Adorama every Thursday as well as the Adorama TV series On Set with Daniel Norton.

RSVP: http://www.findspark.com/event/digitalspeednetworking/

Where: Around the world, LIVE on your computer. This is an online Twitter Q&A event.

Registration: FREE

Hashtag: #FindSpark

Whether it’s for personal or professional connections, we can’t go a single day without interacting with someone through virtual world. Now, add speed networking with a digital aspect to it – sounds terrifying but is a great way to network with multiple people at once from the comfort of wherever you are. By building a strong network, you’ll have a group of people who will help reach your goals and be there for support through every step of your career.

How can you make the most of it? We’ll be talking about ways to reach out to a stranger online, how to take the conversation to real life, and the best way to build relationships! It’s your chance to ask FindSpark employers, speaker alum, Team FindSpark, and more your career questions.

results.description:
This is a technical meetup between NYC Mesh and the core IPFS developers. Come along if you are interested in IPFS and how it could work with our mesh network.

IPFS is a peer-to-peer distributed file system that seeks to connect all computing devices with the same system of files. In some ways, IPFS is similar to the Web, but IPFS could be seen as a single BitTorrent swarm, exchanging objects within one Git repository.
results.name: IPFS new peer-to-peer hypermedia protocol

results.description:
Updated March 7th, 2016

Given the warmth that has descended upon NYC, I am making Tuesdays/Thursdays active again, but at 5pm.

This is one of three sites/listserves that promotes weekly games that have been going on for many many years. Stall counts are used on occasion, cleats are optional, boundaries are flexible, and all skill levels are welcome!

There are two ways to stay in touch outside of Meetup.com:

- Follow us on Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/nycultimate
- Like us on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/nycultimate

SPRING/SUMMER (Mar - Aug)

As the city warms up we play four times a week. Our main location is Riverside Park, with Morningside and Booker T Washington as backups.

There are four days that we play:

- Saturdays at 10am, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Sundays at 12pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Tuesdays at 5pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End - Where we can!)
- Thursdays at 5pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End - Where we can!)

Damien
[masked]

RIVERSIDE DETAILS

The Riverside location is all the way West just off the water between 102nd and 108th Streets. You can only enter the park at 103rd and 108th. The best way to get there is to take the 1 local to 103rd Street. Walk West until you see an entrance that takes you down to the fields through the park. After walking down the steps from the street, you will see a path that goes left and another that goes right. Walk down the left path until you see a stone wall and stairs that go down to the fields. From South to North there will be one small soccer field surrounded by a track (red 'A' on map), another field with two softball fields (closer to 103rd/104th st) and another that is a giant soccer field (closer to 106th st). After walking down the steps, you will see the small Soccer field on your left. Start from this Southern-most field and walk North on the path to find our game. If you see no one, the meeting spot is the South side of the large soccer field. This spot is identified on the map below, a small square with little dots around it. On days when we can't find space at Riverside, we will move the game to Morningside Park (West 110th St and Manhattan Ave).

MORNINGSIDE DETAILS

The Morningside location is at the corner of 110th Street and Manhattan Avenue. The best way to get there is to take the B or C local to 110th Street. You can also take the 1 train to 110th street at Broadway and then walk East. We will play at the South end of the baseball field parallel to 110th street so that we're not in the way of the baseball games. Riverside will be our backup if for some reason we need to change locations.

BOOKER T. WASHINGTON DETAILS

This location is between 107th & 108th Streets just West of Columbus Avenue. It's on the backside of the high school. The best way to get there is to take the B or C local to 110th Street. 

+++

OTHER SEASONS...

WINTER (Nov - Feb)

During the colder months we generally play two times a week depending on weather. Our main location is Riverside Park with Morningside as a backup.

There are two days that we play:

- Saturdays at 10am, Riverside Park (108th and West End - Big Soccer Field)
- Sundays at 1pm, Riverside Park (108th and West End - Big Soccer Field)
*Tuesdays/Thursdays at 6pm games don't last long due to decreasing sunlight.

FALL (Sep - Oct)

There are four days that we play:

- Saturdays at 10am, Morningside Park (110th and Manhattan Ave)
- Sundays at 4pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Tuesdays at 5:30pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Thursdays at 5:30pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)

results.description:
Join us as we welcome:

Dr. James Lebret

Assistant Professor, NYU School of Medicine

The 9 Habits of Highly Effective Innovators

3/24/[masked] pm

Mailman School of Public Health Auditorium, Floor R8

722 W 168th St, New York, NY 10032

**Join us afterwards for Coogans HITLAB Happy Hour! First 25 seminar attendees receive a free drink voucher.**

Jim Lebret, MD is Assistant Professor of Medicine and Clinical Innovation at NYU Medical Center, Director of Code Team Leaders at Bellevue Hospital, Fellow in the Institute for Innovations in Medical Education (IIME) and Associate Director for Technology, Innovation and Entrepreneurship (TIE @NYUMC).

He is passionate about innovation and takes an inside-out and outside-in approach to promoting it in NYC: From the inside out, he advises student, resident and faculty entrepreneurs at NYUMC, is a steering committee member for the inaugural NYU Entrepreneurial Institute's Healthcare Innovation Makerthon--which drew over 400 entrants--and developed curricula that have been adopted by NYU School of Medicine in simulation and reflective practice.

From the outside in, Jim has created connections across NYC’s startup ecosystem and promotes the very best startups for opportunities to make connections, pilot and partner. Currently, he closely advises three startups and maintains relationships with Apple, Cornell Tech, Google, Mount Sinai, Columbia, Northwell, Pfizer, DOH, HHS, Accenture, Sharecare, the New York Times, CityMD, Blueprint Health, IBM-Watson, Oscar, HITLAB, Y-Combinator, UCSF, Stanford, MedicineX, Reason Street, Health 2.0, Kaiser Permanente, NYU-X, AlleyWatch and WebMD. He is certain that we live in a time of unprecedented opportunity to combine clinical and technological insights and has recently decreased his clinical time to focus on innovation and health
results.how_to_find_us: Photo ID must be presented to security upon entry. Take the elevator 1 floor down to Floor R*. Make an immediate right to find the auditorium.
results.name: HITLAB Seminar Series: Dr. James Lebret, NYU Medical Center

results.description:
Afraid of brioche?  Learn how simple and satisfying it can be in this basic brioche 3 hour workshop, with a focus on 2 color brioche.  


Prerequisite:

You must already know how to cast on, knit, purl, and bind off.  This is not a learn to knit workshop, but rather a specific technique workshop.


Materials:

Two solid (or semi solid) yarns in worsted weight (high contrast would be ideal)


Appropriately sized needles for your yarn.  Circular (length doesn't matter) or double pointed will work for this (straight needle's won't work).  We'll be creating a flat swatch about 20 stitches wide.  Brioche stitch knits up loosely so you may want to choose needles a size down from what you'd normally use on worsted yarn.

If you came to this workshop before, please feel welcome to come again and we can pick up where you left off, improving your understanding of this technique.
results.name: Knitting Workshop - Two Color Brioche

Please join our friends from The Catholic Fellowship of Young Filipino Professionals, a member group of The Catholic Fellowship, as we celebrate Visita Iglesia, a Filipino Lenten tradition.

During Visita Iglesia, we pray the Stations of the Cross, walking amongst seven Manhattan churches.

We will kick off the event by attending the Holy Thursday mass at St. Patrick’s Cathedral at 5:30pm. It will definitely be crowded but if you would like to sit with us, we plan to be seated on the leftmost side facing the altar closer to the front (on the 51st Street side).

After the 5:30pm mass at St. Patrick's Cathedral, please meet at the First Station of the Cross. We will also have CFYFP signs so you can easily find the group.

If you cannot join us at 5:30pm, please feel free to participate at any point in the succeeding activities of this event.  Please contact Michael Gonzales [masked]), so you can catch up with us.

***ITINERARY***:

St. Patrick's Cathedral

5th Ave bet. 50th and 51st Streets

Meet the group at the First Station of the Cross after the 5:30pm Mass


St. Agnes

143 E 43rd St. bet. Lexington + 3rd Ave.


Holy Family

St. John the Evangelist

Our Lady of Peace

237 E 62nd St. bet. 2nd + 3rd Ave.


St. Catherine of Sienna

St. Vincent Ferrer

869 Lexington Ave. at 66th St.

results.description:
Join the AMC's Youth Opportunities Program, AMC NY-NoJ Chapter, and The National Parks Service for a social and film screening you won't want to miss!

Our social hour will begin at 5:30pm where people will be able to learn about the different groups present, how to get involved and meet like-minded individuals. National Parks Service will be starting us off with a short film about Gateway National Recreation Area in NYC! Followed by the screening of "An American Ascent" at 6:45pm.

Complimentary popcorn and beverages provided.

SYNOPSIS:
AN AMERICAN ASCENT documents the first African-American expedition to tackle Denali (aka Mt. McKinley, North America's highest peak), while shedding light on the complex relationship many African-Americans have with the outdoors. As the United States transitions to a "minority majority" nation, a staggering number of people of color do not identify with America's wild places. By embarking on the grueling multi-week climb of 20,237ft Denali, nine African-American climbers try to bridge this "adventure gap" - challenging outdated notions of what adventure looks like by changing the face of America's biggest and baddest mountain on the 100th anniversary of its first summit.

IMPORTANT:
To attend this event you MUST follow the link below for tickets. Tickets for this event are FREE but only those who have registered for this event will be admitted.

Follow this link for registration:
http://activities.outdoors.org/search/index.cfm/action/details/id/89100
results.name: Film Screening - An American Ascent

Please join our friends from The Catholic Fellowship of Young Filipino Professionals, a member group of The Catholic Fellowship, as we celebrate Visita Iglesia, a Filipino Lenten tradition.

During Visita Iglesia, we pray the Stations of the Cross, walking amongst seven Manhattan churches.

We will kick off the event by attending the Holy Thursday mass at St. Patrick’s Cathedral at 5:30pm. It will definitely be crowded but if you would like to sit with us, we plan to be seated on the leftmost side facing the altar closer to the front (on the 51st Street side).

After the 5:30pm mass at St. Patrick's Cathedral, please meet at the First Station of the Cross. We will also have CFYFP signs so you can easily find the group.

If you cannot join us at 5:30pm, please feel free to participate at any point in the succeeding activities of this event.  Please contact Michael Gonzales [masked]), so you can catch up with us.

results.description:
If you care about the future of our planet the way I do (I hope you do!), this is an important discussion topic. Presented by the Earth Institute at Columbia University. Reception to follow. This sustainability discussion is FREE to the public, but must RSPV. Details and registration HERE:
http://earth.columbia.edu/events/view/81872

Moderated by Steve Cohen, Executive Director, The Earth Institute; Professor in the Practice of Public Affairs, School of International and Public Affairs, Columbia University

Event starts at 6, but be sure to arrive early as the talk starts promptly and is only scheduled for one hour. ***********************************

It was once assumed that investing in environmentally friendly companies meant accepting higher risk or lower returns, but that is no longer the case. As investors become more aware of climate and sustainability risks, financial markets are shifting in response. One in every six dollars invested in the United States is screened for environmental, social or governance factors, and the proportion is rising. Green investment strategies  whether that means investing in mature businesses with optimized environmental footprints or in new business models arising from the demand for sustainable products  are gaining traction. This panel brings together a diverse array of professionals to discuss the emerging trends and challenges in the green investment world. It will focus especially on the role that public policy can play in encouraging and facilitating green investment. What are the policy tools, incentives, guarantees and other mechanisms that steer green investment effectively? How do you leverage public dollars to unlock private finance for green growth? Panelists will examine the extent to which green companies rely on government subsidies or tax incentives, and discuss how sustainable investing can help provide the capital to scale clean energy technology needed for a sustainable economy.

***********************************
results.name: Building a Public-Private Partnership to Finance the Green Economy

results.description:
Join us for a panel, we're getting  insight into the latest in technology all the way from Estonia on hot topics: FinTech, Blockchain, Info Security, e-Residency, more...

You must use this link to officially register, meetup RSVP is not sufficient;  http://bit.ly/1OPsjH7


Learn about the world's first e-Residency program, which can provide a digital identity to anyone in the around the world interested in safely and securely administering location-independent business online through convenient  digital services. Identit.ee, originally from Estonia, is coming to New York to explore and share how this program will revolutionize how e-Residency can connect with startups, the Blockchain, e-Government and more.

The event is joined by the MD of the Estonian Government’s e-Residency program, as well as thought leaders in Fintech, Blockchain, Information Security, and e-Government to see how a legally recognized e-identity can help US companies establish themselves in Europe as well as discuss what it means to have an e-Residency, the Blockchain, and how the two combined create a legal digital identity on the Blockchain.

This New York event is part of a global program that will culminate with events running in San Francisco, Berlin, Tokyo, London, Tallinn and more cities tbc.

The panel will include:

Kaspar Korjus - Managing Director of e-Residency in the Government of Estonia

Siim Sikkut - ICT Policy Adviser, Government Office of Estonia


Sten Tamkivi - Co-founder & CEO, Teleport Inc.


John Edge - Chairman, Identity2020


Arie Levy-Cohen - Blockchain Advisor


Joseph Lubin - Founder, ConsenSys Systems


Panel Moderator: John Biggs - East Coast Editor at TechCrunch and Founder at Freemit


You can get your ticket here: http://bit.ly/1OPsjH7

Find more information about the event on the Eventbrite page.

Message us on Meetup to get $10 discount on tickets.

About Byte Academy:  Byte Academy is an industry-focused coding bootcamp in the heart of Manhattan offering full and part-time programs emphasizing Python programming language. Programs include: fullstack Python development, FinTech (financial technology), Data Science and MedTech (medical technology). Byte Academy is the first coding camp in New York City to offer a full-time Python program and is the only in the world to teach FinTech. The school has small classes, career services and placement including access to top industry professionals and events. Byte Academy offers comprehensive financial aid and all women receive a $2,000 off tuition upon acceptance to the program. Through Byte Academy's Tuition-Deferral Program, qualified applicants pay $0 until they find a job. Byte Academy is now accepting applications for its Part-Time Fullstack Python, FinTech and Data Science Classes!

Follow Byte Academy: @byteacademyco (twitter) @byteacademy (facebook & instagram)
results.name: Digital ID: Blockchain & eResidency Panel w/Identit.ee from Estonia

group.name: Byte Academy: FinTech, Data Science, Python Coding Bootcamp

results.description:
Identit.ee is coming to NYC to explore the potential of the Estonian Government's groundbreaking e-Residency program.  We are bringing together leading Blockchain, Fintech and e-Government communities and thought leaders around the world to explore what e-Residency, e-Identity, and the Blockchain can do together. The core topic is e-residency, but the event is also about Blockchain, Fintech, Security, e-Government and how a legally recognized e-identity can integrate with all this. 


This event has a high level panel on e-Residency and it's global potential, with the Head of Digital Policy of the Estonian Government, and a presentation on e-Residency by the MD of the Government program. The young team will also explain how they launched this initiative as a 'government startup.'

A second panel will introduce opportunities with these technologies followed by attendees breaking into groups to hack ideas around the question: what could you do with e-Residency? These ideas will be presented to the panelists, and will feed directly into the ongoing development of Estonia's e-Residency platform.

This event is a part of the global Identit.ee program that includes events in London, Berlin, Tokyo, San Francisco, Hong Kong, Tallinn and more cities tbc.

You must register at Eventbrite to attend. All the details and registration ($30) can be found on here: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/identitee-event-on-e-residency-blockchain-nyc-tickets-21555987539


The event organizers are offering a discounted entry to attend. Enter 'MeetupNYC' to receive a $10 discount on the admission entry fee.
results.name: Identit.ee Event on e-Residency & Blockchain

results.description:
Please join us for a fireside chat with Mitch Rothschild, founder of Vitals on Thursday, March 24th from 6 - 8pm.

Prompted by a personal experience of not knowing key information about a doctor’s background, Mitch launched Vitals in 2008. For the first seven years, Mitch served as CEO, growing Vitals.com to over 10 million monthly visitors and a 65 percent compounded annual revenue growth rate. He now serves as Chairman of the company.

Prior to Vitals, Mitch started more than a half-dozen businesses, including Raspberry Red Marketing, NetWorks, Tuff Rhino, Awards.com, RUSS CandyBears and Time Warner Viewer’s Edge. He has also been involved in the rapid growth of Popcorn Indiana, Blue Moon Mexican Cafe and IT’SUGAR.

Mitch has an MBA, with honors, from Columbia University and an MA (Phi Beta Kappa, Summa Cum Laude) from Queens College in New York.

Fireside chat format:


• 6:00 - 6:30 pm: Open Networking

• 6:30 - 7:15 pm: Fireside Chat using a Q&A approach, (35mins between speaker and organizer, and 10mins between speaker and audience)

• 7:15 - 8:00 pm: Open Networking

Contribution - $5 with your RSVP online.

Please RSVP by 4pm Wednesday, March 23rd by clicking here. You must RSVP on the Meetup website. No walk-ins will be allowed!

Beer, wine, and snacks will be served.  Can't wait to see you there!

Have a great idea for a guest speaker?  Please let us know!
results.name: Fireside Chat w/ Mitch Rothschild - Founder of Vitals

results.description:
Photo: STSANY members and guests at our Jacques Torres Chocoholics Getting to Know You event on March 19, 2016!

Had a lovely time ! I felt welcomed and enjoyed meeting everyone there. Everyone was friendly and this made me want to come back again.____Rick, STSANY member who attended our Getting to Know You! event at Jacques Torres 


REMINDER about our March 24 workshop:

GREETINGS, STSANY SINGERS, ACTORS & INSTRUMENTALISTS!

Would you like to improve your performing skills and try out your songs and monologues in a friendly, helpful atmosphere? Come to our first Spring workshop for singers, actors and instrumentalists on Thursday, March 24, from 6:00-7:30 p.m., approximately. Spread the word and bring a guest or two.


STSANY welcomes NEW MEMBERS, FIRST-TIMERS, Pros, Non-Pros, Semi-Pros and invited GUESTS to this workshop and all those to follow.

Meetup Fees: Members: $20; Participating Guests; $15; Observers: $10. Policy: Exact amount in cash at the door, when you attend each meetup.

Please arrive 10 minutes prior to the meetup, if possible, as elevators are busy at that hour.

• RSVP DEADLINE is at 10:00 p.m. on Wednesday, March 23. You must RSVP on this posting page. IMPORTANT! If you RSVP and decide you cannot attend, be sure to change your RSVP to "no." This is a firm STSANY requirement so please adhere to it as a courtesy to your organizer and fellow members! Scheduling is difficult.

All workshops benefit members who want to improve their vocal, acting  and instrumental technique and interpretation. They provide a safe, supportive, AFFORDABLE, enjoyable atmosphere which addresses self-confidence, stage fright and other matters important to our members. Workshops are a first step in providing performance and volunteer opportunities.

Besides workshops and private lessons, members have the chance to perform in showcases, concerts, informal musicales, plays and musicals, and to volunteer to participate in outreach events around the City, which is incredibly rewarding!  


MEETUPS serve several purposes: 

* Learning: You are given instruction in singing and acting technique and interpretation, and you also learn from watching and listening to others. 

•  Networking: You are encouraged to exchange information and possibly collaborate with other members (before, at a break and after the meetup) with whom you feel an affinity, personally and/or performance-wise, and to possibly collaborate with them on  STSANY projects or outside the meetup;

•  Performance Opportunities: Concerts, Musical and/or Theatrical Events, One or Two-Person Shows, Informal Musicales, Outreach events including those during the December holidays, and more....

•  Volunteering: Please volunteer to be an assistant organizer (talk to me about your special talents!), and to help out at our various events;

• Social: Enjoy meeting and getting to know others either before, during a break, after meetup is over and at purely social events.

IMPORTANT! Although I ALWAYS send updates, if necessary, be sure to keep checking the postings for meetups and your emails about the day and time of each meetup. Weather conditions, illness and unforeseen events can cause cancellations. 

What to bring to all meetup workshops: (Please read, carefully!) 

Singers: Bring 2 copies of 2 contrasting songs of any style (entire sheet music). If you don't have written songs, let me know and I can provide some at the meetup.

NOTE! If you don't wish to sing solo, please join us in our group numbers. Getting started is the important thing.  The shyness will subside, little by little.

Actors: Bring 2 copies of 2 contrasting monologues, poems or recitations.

Instrumentalists: Be prepared to play one or two contrasting pieces of any style.

YOU ARE ENCOURAGED TO RECORD the meetups for continued learning and inspiration!

PRIVATE LESSONS are offered from 11:00 a.m to 8:00 p.m., by appointment, on weekdays/nights, and on Saturdays(sometimes Sundays) from 10:00 a.m. - 2:00 p.m. Member discount cost: $75 for 45 minutes. (Non-members: $85) 

TO read about STSANY's GOALS and reviews, click on pages: http://www.meetup.com/SOMETHING-TO-SING-ABOUT-IN-NEW-YORK/about/

To see and hear members perform, please VISIT and SUBSCRIBE TO our youtube channel by clicking on this link: https://www.youtube.com/user/AlmaMusica/videos?view_as=public

Be inspired and live your DREAMS! Carpe diem!

All the best,

Anna 

www.annabartos.com

Founder-Director, STSANY since 2010

Founder-Director, Flor y Canto Chamber Ensemble since 1998

NYU Vocal Faculty from[masked] 

REVIEWS by STSANY members, fellow performers and event audience members: 

Anna Bartos is not only a superb singing teacher (she knows her music), she is an equally excellent coach, which is a rarity among singing teachers. She is also capable of imparting manyhelpful nuggets of information about the process of singing and performing that one doesn't usually receive from one's teacher. I found her instruction of enormous value.___. P. Vincent, NYC actor, playwright and STSANY showcase performer.

It was a wonderful session w/a warm, knowledgeable & insightful instructor & in great company!____Allyson, Member, STSANY

Fortunately for me I had the pleasure of Anna helping me with my singing technique which is something that I have always wanted to do. You should all attend this meetup whether you are experienced or a beginner (like me). You will be able to discover something so unique and wonderful about yourself with this group. I can guarantee it! _____Chels, Member, STSANY


An excellent meetup! Anna knows her stuff and helped me improve my performances; the other members/performers are talented and friendly and fun."____Glen, Member, STSANY

The MUSICALE was a wonderfully diverse program in an intimate setting. I found the preliminary workshops extremely helpful in putting a role I'd worked on into a historical, musical, and linguistic framework. Anna Bartos is knowledgeable about a broad range of musical styles and genres, acting and character development as well as singing. ____Rebecca, Member of STSANY (Musicale on 1/19/14)

Amazing event. Thank you, Anna for holding the musicale. I am also glad to meet new singers.___Saadat, Member of STSANY

What a delightful surprise!  Congratulations to Anna, a real pro, and an impressive mentor to a diverse array of talent. The 'meet-up' seems to be a real resource for both the performers and those of us in the audience.  Keep up the good work!____Mary Jay, Seasoned Senior Performer

It was a privilege to work with Anna Bartos on this 9/11 memorial concert. All of the performers were of high caliber and the audience rewarded our efforts with heartfelt applause. The program, with its mixture of styles and its emphasis on Americana, was just perfect for the anniversary date. I had a great time yesterday. It was a meaningful and well-organized concert.___ Moshe Knoll, Professional Classical pianist.

Thank you so much for inviting us to perform on this wonderful 9/11 concert.___Rosa Hyewon, Classical Guitarist

results.description:
Design is the critical component of a successful email campaign, but email design has its own unique set of challenges that many designers aren’t even aware of.

Audiences are reading and interacting with email on many different devices with varying screen sizes. How do you design a compelling message for so many varied experiences? What are the responsive coding issues that you’ll face?

This seminar will help clarify the design process for you. We will look at how design impacts an email campaign’s success rates, design limitations, and methods for turning these limitations into strengths. You will come away with an understanding of the best practices for designing email that looks great on both desktop and mobile.

In this 2-hour seminar you’ll learn the following:

The ideal balance of text & images
Designing on a grid
Ideal widths for your designs
Coding necessary to make your email responsive
Typography & choosing fonts
Emphasizing readability
Best practices for handling images that do not load automatically
Compelling clickthroughs & calls to action
How your design may change in difficult clients, such as Outlook and Gmail for Mobile


RSVP

https://www.nobledesktop.com/seminars?register_for=133
results.name: Responsive Email

results.description:
The focus of this meeting will be the Worldwide Status of Women.  Our presenter, Pamela Timmins sends this message: "I am honored to attend the Humanist's meet-up on Thursday evening, March 24th, to give you all a brief on my direct experience of the 60th NGO United Nations Commission on the Status of Women being held presently. Earlier that same day, I will have been attending a last meeting in this series at a program called Voices of Women Worldwide, or VOWW-TV, which I will be attending as a producer of media for Manhattan Neighborhood Network."

Speakers at the Commission on the Status of Women urged employing methods of empowerment, and linking to an earlier approved Working Methods Document, advocating: "We need to unite and use openings in civil society to strengthen our voices and our effectiveness in addressing violence against women and implementing the Sustainable Development Goals at a regional level."

There are 17 Sustainable Development Goals, including one on Gender Equality, which took effect on January 1st, 2016. For more information please visit: www.ngocsw.org

There is concern for the Voices of Women Worldwide and the need for Transforming Violence Against Women Migrants in Africa, Armenia & Middle East. There were presentations on Integrative Approaches by various colleagues and organizations, one of which is called "Meaningfulworld."

I hope to see you at the meeting.
results.how_to_find_us: Moonstruck at Third Avenue and 31st Street, second floor
results.name: The Worldwide Status of Women

results.description:
March 24

Personal Reflections on Wondrous Worlds: Ahsan Watts
Ahsan Watts has worked as a valued member of the Newark Museum Facilities staff, and offers commentary from a unique perspective of familiarity and personal experience.
6-6:45 pm

Images and Realities Films: Act of Vengeance directed by Mahsun Kirmizigül
7 pm

Special guest: Mucahit Bilici, Associate Professor of Sociology at John Jay College, CUNY and author of Finding Mecca in America

Danny Glover (Lethal Weapon) stars in this action-filled drama of international intrigue and terror, friendship and revenge, faith and prejudice. Act of Vengeance splits its time between Istanbul and New York when Turkish agents are dispatched to the US in connection with an international arrest warrant for Hadji Gumus, a well-respected Muslim scholar and family man, that takes us on a journey to answer whether innocence or guilt matters to one who lusts for vengeance. Includes magnificent performances from Robert Patrick (Terminator 2; Judgment Day), Gina Gershon (Face/Off), and the film’s director and Turkish actor, Mahsun Kirmizigül. 2010, 97 minutes

“a riveting tale…” — Melissa Orcine, CinemaParadiso

For information on future films in this series please click on the dates below.

- See more at: http://www.newarkmuseum.org/islamic-film-series-march-24#sthash.aChcK8rt.dpuf
results.name: Images and Realities Films: Act of Vengeance

results.description:
The goal...meet new people, share good news, have some fun. 

To be admitted you MUST bring a piece of “Good News” to share. The goal is to change the conversation and talk about what is going right, what is working and who is supporting you in living your dreams. 

The energy of these Happy Happy Hours is always amazing and I leave so energized by all of the beautiful souls who attend. 

When you share and savor your positive memories and events you actually build your resiliency, and you gain the strength to live a happier life. Positive emotions increase your creativity, decrease your stress levels, improve your sleep and strengthen your immune system. It is all good. 

This months Happy Happy Hour is being hosted by the owners of 14 & Hudson in Piermont. Drink specials and some small plates will be shared! 


MAKE it a great day! 

Michele Phillips

results.description:
Title: Evolution of Big Data Search & Analytics - The Nexus of Natural Language Processing, Machine Learning & Cognitive Computing presented by Xavier Pornain


Cognitive computing, semantic technologies and machine learning are fundamentally changing the way that information is located, discovered and utilized by consumers and knowledge workers. These technologies have changed the focus of enterprise search and discovery solutions to become more knowledge and action based, delivering insights, predictions and recommendations to consumers.

The value in the unstructured content is unique to each organization, and unlocking it is not a trivial task as many organizations face roadblocks because of a lack of appropriate technology and processes.

During this session, discover how Sinequa’s Big Data Search & Analytics platform can tackle these data challenges with existing use cases at AstraZeneca and a large telecom provider.
results.how_to_find_us: 52ND STREET BTWN PARK & MADISON AVE (21st floor)
results.name: Evolution of Enterprise Search - The Nexus of NLP, ML & Cognitive Computing

**THIS EVENT IS NOT A CRYPTOPARTY AS IT WILL BE TAPED ON CAMERA FOR TV. IF YOU DON'T WANNA BE ON TAPE PLEASE COME TO THE NEXT ONE.** 


Viceland the new VICE TV channel is interested in doing a recording of this event. We are relaxing our catham house rule for this special "cryptochat".

On Thursday, March 24st, please join us in Har
lem. 

We will talk about some of the issues of the day. We will have a special fformer , co-founder & co-chairperson CEO of Wickr ( http://www.wickr.com )  and now head of the Wickr Foundation ( http://www.wickr.org ), Nico Sell ( 
http://venturebeat.com/2015/01/13/wickr-ceo-nico-sell-behind-the-glasses/ )



About Nico Sell:
Nico Sell, a professional artist, athlete and entrepreneur based in California, is now leading Wickr Foundation, a non-profit dedicated to advancing privacy, digital security, and uncensored access to information. Having been focused on security for over two decades, Nico Sell helped to start dozens of successful start-ups and organizations. In the past 15 years, she has assisted the Dark Tangent’s team to organize DEF CON, one of the largest hacker conventions in the world. Nico Sell is co-founder and co-chairman of Wickr, Inc., a secure communications platform providing end-to-end encryption to users in over 190 countries around the world. She also has launched r00tz Asylum, a non-profit, focused on teaching kids how to love being white-hat hackers. Nico Sell serves as an adviser to various security-focused start-ups including AllClear ID, Crowdstrike and Lookout.

- - -

# WHAT'S A CRYPTOPARTY ## ## ## ## 
Cryptoparty Harlem:


**THIS EVENT IS NOT A CRYPTOPARTY AS IT WILL BE TAPED ON CAMERA FOR TV. IF YOU DON'T WANNA BE ON TAPE PLEASE COME TO THE NEXT ONE.**

Sorry no chips, dip, awesome music or drinks. Just food for your mind. Ever wonder how to stay private, safe, & secure in today's digital age? What is a cryptoparty anyway? A CryptoParty is free, public and fun. People bring their computers, mobile devices,  and a willingness to learn! In the time of the event, people will learn and teach how to use basic cryptography tools. Cryptoparties are decentralized global events that are organized to answer questions and instruct people on technology & privacy. Cryptoparties are always free to attend, public, commercially and politically non-aligned and absolutely against sexual harassment and discrimination.

There are no dumb questions, you do not need to know anything about this subject, nor do you even need to bring a computer or phone. However that will help you get the most of it. 

This event is always open to everyone and free. We spend hours promoting the event in the community each month not just online. We purposely hand our flyers to anyone & everyone. We also do not ever discriminate. All are welcome regardless of gender/gender non-conformity, age, technical knowledge, race, class, privilege,sexual orientation,etc. Harlem is a diverse beautiful melting pot and we want to represent that.  


For more information see the global cryptoparty website:

</a>http://www.cryptoparty.in/

# WHY ## ## ## ##

we will be available to answer, discuss, teach, and learn about secure mobile use, secure browsing (using tor), secure email (using gpg), and secure chat (using otr).  


**THIS EVENT IS NOT A CRYPTOPARTY AS IT WILL BE TAPED ON CAMERA FOR TV. IF YOU DON'T WANNA BE ON TAPE PLEASE COME TO THE NEXT ONE.**

# BUT WHY HARLEM?! ## ## ##

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EDq-OzMWQwg

 A lot of people don't know that back in December of 2013 NYC lauched The Harlem WiFi network (<a href="http://harlemfreewifi.com/">http://harlemfreewifi.com/) rolled out by Sky-Packets ( </a>http://www.sky-packets.com/muni-wifi/ ) it extends 95 city blocks, from 110th to 138th Streets between Frederick Douglass Boulevard and Madison Avenue making it at the time the largest continuous free outdoor public wireless network in the nation. The internet is literally all around us and free in Harlem! Throw in the fact that african americans over index on mobile phone usage (<a href="http://www.pewinternet.org/2014/01/06/african-americans-and-technology-use/">92% of African Americans own a cell phone, and 56% own a smartphone). So what better place to learn about using tech safely.

@geminiimatt has lived in harlem for over a decade and has seen it change for the good & bad. However one thing that has stayed the same is the high level of surveillance & scrutiny faced by residents.  ONLINE: Please read Ben Popper's examination of the fallout from NYPD's Operation Crew Cut ,  "How the NYPD is using social media to put Harlem teens behind bars" (http://www.theverge.com/2014/12/10/7341077/nypd-harlem-crews-social-media-rikers-prison) , ON THE CORNER: Via official nypd cctv surveillance cameras & private owned cameras & FROM UP ABOVE: via SkyWatch tactical platform units and shotspotter (</a>https://www.aclu.org/blog/free-future/shotspotter-ceo-answers-questions-gunshot-detectors-cities), gunshot detection devices. 

Our objective is to liberate the people of Harlem. We have sky watch towers on our streets, we have flood lights in our public housing courtyards, we have remote control surveillance cameras on our corners, automatic license place readers scan the roads, and shot stopper microphones listen from the rooftops. whenever there is a protest, cell phone calls & text are intercepted by stingrays. The inner city is the test bed for these technologies, many of which were designed to fight the war on terror. If this surveillance over reach & over policing isnt confronted in the urban areas of this country who knows where it will grow to next.

TWO FACTOR AUTHENTICATION: 
</a>https://twofactorauth.org/
the above link takes you to a list of sites that use 2-step verification.  2-step verification uses your name, password, but then another unknown to piece of info to log in. It can be provided by a hardware token, a texted code or via apps like Google Authenticator, Authy, etc. you can also use the site to help by requesting groups start using 2-step verification.

If you use facebook here is link to the event there (please like our page):

results.description:
Hi-ARTS Gallery (www.hi-artsnyc.org)
presents NYCasitas featuring photographer Martha Cooper's seldom seen 1980's images of casitas, small Caribbean style homes found in Puerto Rico that were recreated on vacant lots throughout the city. Cooper's photos shot in Spanish Harlem, the Bronx, Brooklyn and the Lower East Side, capture the resilient Puerto Rican communities that built these casitas and gardens for social gatherings, birthdays, domino games, cookouts and performances.

http://static1.squarespace.com/static/55f83646e4b07a36afefab23/t/56d9c964b6aa60744e43f1ab/1457113458690/?format=750w

Our Meetup

For this exhibit opening, we'll meet at the gallery starting at 6pm to view the photos and meet the curator, Hi-ARTS staff, photojournalist Martha Cooper and other members of the group.

The Hi-ARTS Gallery is located at 304 East 100th Street. If you have any questions, running late, need more information on parking and etc., feel free to call/text Daniel at 774.275.3646. 

Directions to the Hi-ARTS Gallery

The closest subway is the #6 train to 96th Street & Lexington Avenue, then walking east to 96th street & 2nd Avenue, then north 4 blocks. The gallery is on 100th street between 2nd and 1st avenues. The M15 bus line stops nearby, along 1st Avenue (uptown) or 2nd Avenue (downtown).

Thanks and see you there!
results.how_to_find_us: Inside the Gallery

results.description:
Join us for Jon Kern, Thursday, March 24th at 6:30 PM!

We are bringing Agile Manifesto co-author and signer, Jon Kern, to Northern Virginia and we'd like you to join us -- no travel involved!

We will be streaming this event to our sister Scaling Agile groups so you can enjoy Jon Kern from a location convenient to you. 

For FREE! There is no cost to participate -- simply visit EventBrite- Jon Kern to register for this event.

About this event: It would seem that Agile isn’t the foolproof silver bullet that we said it would be! Oh, wait. We never said that. Let me re-phrase this a bit. Ahem. Ok, so not all groups doing agile succeed in delivering software. And not all folks trained in two days of Scrum are magically anointed with the agile wisdom of Ron Jeffries and a Midas touch. 

What should we do? Go back to Waterfall? Train people for four days? Well, I think it is time we do a re-set, and educate folks on what agile is all about. If you are dogmatically following along with a handful of agile practices, stuck in “shu” but don’t really “get” the intentions behind the agile mindset, you may (will?) be disappointed.

In this talk, we will: 

Look to understand the principles as we co-authors meant them to be. Learn that agile is a state of mind, not a rote process. Being agile requires continuous vigilance and constant partial attention

I’ve always said “agile is hard to do well” and I’m sticking to it! 

About the Speaker:

Jon Kern (@JonKernPA) is passionate about helping clients succeed in delivering business value through software. He works with (typically distributed) teams to articulate, design, architect, and deliver software that solve challenging business problems. From analysis to helping provide solutions, to mentoring teams, and all points in between, Jon routinely has significant impact on the projects he works on. Either working with the client’s team, and/or pulling together a team of experts from around the world—Jon creates a quick-hit ability to solve problems and deliver results. Projects routinely see high quality solutions in less time, and leave the local team mentored on object-oriented and agile techniques, and excited. (Often more valuable than the technical improvements ;-))

Jon has a knack for taking the long view, seeing the big picture—yet knowing the details, and driving business success at every turn. Folks interested in truly establishing a best of breed solution, an enduring sense of quality and process, a desire to deliver business value, and having fun while doing it, love Jon.

His varied career has spanned jet engine R&D, flight simulators, to being an object-oriented and lightweight process evangelist through the 90s, authoring books with Peter Coad, helping to form TogetherSoft, and his work co-authoring the Agile Manifesto for Software Development in 2001. Many credit Jon with much of the stellar success that TogetherSoft enjoyed with the UML modeling/IDE product and with the professional mentor group he formed.

Jon constantly seeks better ways for teams to accomplish their goals, from a technology perspective; and from a people and methodology perspective. Jon likes to help teams build an environment that enables effective practices, solid architecture, agile development, quality-by-design (not accident), and laser-like focus on delivering business value through strategic use of the IT group.

Please note: Attendance is free, but Eventbrite registration in advance is REQUIRED.

Thank you to our sponsors Berkana Enterprise Consulting for providing the speaker, and Excella Consulting for providing the space & live stream.

We look forward to your participation this Thursday!!
results.how_to_find_us: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/a-perfect-solution-for-all-your-development-needs-by-jon-kern-tickets-23933666240 - To register for event!!
results.name: A Perfect Solution for All Your Development Needs- By Jon Kern

What is Inner Engineering?

Inner Engineering is a method, a tool to engineer a deep and lasting personal transformation. 
It is a combination of methods and technologies derived from the ancient science of yoga. 
It is a comprehensive system addressing every aspect of human wellbeing – from body, mind and emotion to the fundamental life energy within us.

Over two million people have completed the “Inner Engineering” program worldwide and have reported remarkable results. The program includes engaging discourses exploring the nature of the mind and practical wisdom to manage life situations, along with guided meditations, group discussions, simple yoga postures, and a powerful and purifying energy technique designed to bring one’s entire system into alignment and harmony.

What does the program offer?

Enlightening interactive sessionsGuided MeditationsAsanas, simple yoga posturesShambhavi Mahamudra, a powerful , 21-minute energy technique that brings your entire system into alignment so that your body, mind, emotions and energies function in harmony

Benefits

- Improved mental clarity,sleep quality, and increased energy levels

-Ability to handle stressful situations effortlessly. 

- Deepening of interpersonal relationships, thus cultivating a greater sense of connectivity at home, work and in the community

- Helps to purify the five elements (earth, water, fire, air, space) in the body leading to pleasantness in the body, mind and emotionRelief from chronic ailments.

- Access to the intelligence and competence within, which is the very source of creationGreater peace and joy in everyday life 

Who Should Attend?

- The program is for anyone age 14+, with no requirements of previous experience or physical agility. This is not about becoming strong or learning to stand on your head, but it is a technology for looking at the fundamentals of your life and nurturing your complete wellbeing. The technology of Inner Engineering is like driving a car – no matter what your background, beliefs, religion, or culture, if you learn to drive the car properly, it will take you places!

Sadhguru, a yogi and mystic, and one of the foremost authorities on yoga, offers his characteristically pragmatic wisdom for a life of joy and fulfillment. Starting with four basic dimensions of the self –Body, Mind, Emotions, and Energy – Sadhguru introduces us to simple techniques to realign and transform them into a life of sparkling aliveness.

Inner Engineering is a method of enhancing yourself and emerging into the ideal way you want to be. It is a 7-session online course that provides tools and solutions to empower yourself to create your life the way you want it. It gives you the opportunity to intellectually explore the ABC’s of life using methods from the distilled essence of yogic sciences. The course provides a simple, easy to use, proven methods to empower yourself for self-empowerment.

This 1 hour introduction to Inner Engineering explains the fundamental approach of the program in a live setting that offers you the opportunity to ask a trained Isha teacher questions about the program and practices available.

“Inner Engineering is neither a religion, nor a philosophy or dogma; It is a technology for wellbeing. One does not have to believe or disbelieve, you just have to learn to use it. Technology will produce results irrespective of who you are.” – Sadhguru

results.description:
In this talk, Jesse will cover the persona framework used by the ADP digital product teams. A key challenge for companies like ADP, that have a number of teams working on a wide variety of  products, is to create consistency between products that serve unique functions.  

To facilitate this challenge, ADP established a persona framework that has specificity at the product level, while still providing coherency across their broad product ecosystem.

Teams at ADP start with basic research that defines Behavioral Archetypes for a market. These Archetypes are used across teams and extended within context to create locally relevant Personas. These Personas are used during team-focused activities such as Sprint Planning and during cross-team activities such as Sprint Demos. Join us for an inspirational evening on how to scale your research Persona activities! 


Presenter from ADP:


Jesse Zolna, Director of UX Research at ADP’s Innovation Lab, NYC

Jesse Zolna is the Director of UX Research at ADP's Innovation Lab, a special venture that works to bring Enterprise Software into the consumer age through Research, Design Thinking and Innovative Technology. Jesse previously led Marketing and Product Research at Nook by Barnes and Noble and worked for various design and research agencies. He has a PhD in Engineering Psychology from Georgia Institute of Technology and Degrees in Psychology and in HCI from Tufts University.

About Our Sponsor:

Lifion, by ADP, invites you to visit our new home for big ideas, ambitious folks, and those who are truly committed to delivering finely made products at scale. Join us after-hours for provocative talks, engaging discussions and some great opportunities to connect with serious thinkers and doers. Visit us at www.lifion.com for a calendar of upcoming events and current job opportunities. We look forward to meeting you soon!
results.name: Personas at Scale

results.description:
REVOLUTIONIZING BUSINESS WITH ICE VIRTUAL REALITY 

Leading technology innovator Barrie Loberg, from Calgary, Canada, has progressive ideas about the business applications for virtual reality. Known for his invention of ICE software®, a visual configurator meant for the design, manufacturing and construction industries, and built on a video game platform, Loberg leads the charge in adapting virtual reality for business. With a video game platform at its core, ICE is built to adapt quickly to advances in technologies such as virtual reality.

Intent on creating a unique and powerful experience, Barrie’s first initiative was to develop a virtual reality experience that combined magnetic field generators, the Oculus Rift headset and ICE. With Barrie’s ICE VR experience, participants walk around a physical space while inside the 3D interface of the software, making changes to finishes and dimensions while gathering pricing and manufacturing information real-time. This one of a kind experience uses a wireless setup to track participants’ head movements and location as they walk through the 3D world. Using virtual transporter spots throughout the 3D space, participants are transported from different points in the design file to ‘recycle’ the physical space. 

Barrie inspires audiences with his passion for technology applications to solve business problems. His thought-provoking discussion of virtual reality will leave you inspired and ready to explore ways you can bring technology into your own business.

ICE VIRTUAL REALITY EXPERIENCE

With the ICE Virtual Reality Experience, participants explore their customized ICE layout wearing virtual reality goggles. They are transported from their immediate physical surroundings to the virtual environment in ICE. Participants are able to navigate, make product changes and see the entire project updated, including the price and downstream order information. The power of the ICE Virtual Reality Experience lies in the ability of the participant to make decisions about the design before they purchase; they can see it, change it, price it and get all the information needed to make a decision quickly and accurately.

At DIRTT’s global headquarters, Ice Edge has hosted over 1,000 guests through the ICE Virtual Reality experience in the 1,200 square foot lab. Using magnetic field generators, guests are able to walk through ICE using a combination of technologies to create one of the few walkable virtual reality experiences in the world. Guests are enthralled as design details change around them, and immersed in experiences like standing at the edge of a 60-foot balcony, forcing them to think twice before stepping off.

BARRIE LOBERG

Barrie Loberg, VP, Software Development and co-founder of DIRTT is the inventor of ICE software and has over 22 years of experience in the technology and interior construction industries. Originally, Barrie created ICE in lockstep with DIRTT to respond to their unique approach to construction – complete customization and four-week lead times. In 2007, Ice Edge Business Solutions became a subsidiary to DIRTT as other manufacturers wanted to adopt DIRTT’s technology, ICE software.

ICE EDGE

Ice Edge® Business Solutions is a Canadian technology company, providing a suite of revolutionary software solutions including ICE Software® used for design, configuration and manufacturing. Ice Edge’s innovative approach to technology helps people design, engineer and manufacture their products more efficiently with less waste and errors, while enabling them to go to market faster with highly customizable products. Ice Edge is a wholly owned subsidiary of DIRTT Environmental Solutions (TSX: DRT).

Game description: 

Teams are 4 V 4, no goalies, no gender requirements (but we'd like at least 1 female player per team). Games will be played on a 1st goal rotation basis or 15 minutes time limit. The team that scores first stays on  the field. But if your team remains on the field after scoring 3 goals, we'll split the team up so that everyone has a fair chance to have a great game.

RULES OF THE GAME:

First and most important rule of the game is to have fun and enjoy the time on the field! 

VERY IMPORTANT: 

- NO FOULS

- NO SIDE TACKLING

- NO PUSHING

- NO TELLING OFF

* ZERO TOLERANCE*


By minimizing physical contact, we minimize injuries and violence.


         “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”

If you don't sign up for the game, do not show up.

Rough play and offensive language will absolutely not be tolerated!!

We encourage competitive, but safe play. 

We reserve the right to ask anyone to leave who has exhibited any behavior that could be construed as violent, offensive, or dangerous. 

Those that don't comply with these rules, will kindly be asked to leave the field so others can enjoy the game. 


Any other questions regarding the rules of the game or anything else, should be directed to the organizer directly or to the assistant organizer/s!!!

A positive attitude, pair of sneakers or INDOOR shoes (ONLY), shin guards (recommended) and lots of water.

You will be asked to pay $9.50 dollars when you RSVP. This $9.50 dollars is used to pay for: permits, meetup fees, Amazon fees, Goals, soccer balls etc.

results.description:
Issue: does national security trump privacy rights and certain constitutional protections?

The FBI thinks so and it's compelling Apple to assist in its investigation of the terrorist attacks in San Bernardino, California.  Apple is opposing the FBI Order to compel assistance on several grounds -- among other reasons, that it violates various constitutional protections, especially First and Fifth Amendments.


https://www.google.com/url?sa=t&rct=j&q=&esrc=s&source=web&cd=1&ved=0ahUKEwiV3Ka6ssTLAhVImh4KHcLAC4EQFggcMAA&url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.ndaa.org%2Fpdf%2FSB-Shooter-Order-Compelling-Apple-Asst-iPhone.pdf&usg=AFQjCNF9Rdgc9U6qcNY3aGREimpTpEcDxQ&sig2=GTEvlh29hfbHVc6F9hSUyw&bvm=bv.116954456,d.dmo4456,d.dmo">Click here to view the Court Order compelling Apple to assist with the Agency's search.


Click here to view Apple's legal brief -- Apple, Inc.'s Motion to Vacate Order Compelling Apple to Assist Agents in Search, and Opposition to Government's Motion to Compel Assistance. 


The oral arguments for this Motion is scheduled for March 22, 2016 -- a ripe timing for this important discussion!

Will this case end up before the U.S. Supreme Court?


More details to follow.
results.name: Law, Tech & Politics: FBI v. Apple, Inc.

results.description:
The Beginner Buddhist Book Circle is for anyone interested in or new to Buddhism. In this biweekly series, we’ll explore classic introductory Buddhist books. Although we have “reading assignments”, the meetings focus more on basic Buddhist teachings rather than strict discussions of the books. Our meetings are casual and informal; all levels of interest and experience are welcome. When possible, we’ll have copies of the current book available at no cost. Meetings occur on the second Wednesday and fourth Thursday of the month unless otherwise noted. Please see the Meetup page and calendar for the full schedule.

*** Right Now We’re Reading: “The Heart of the Buddha's Teachings" by Thich Nhat Hanh***

In "The Heart of the Buddha's Teachings", renowned Vietnamese Buddhist monk, teacher, poet, and peace activist Thich Nhat Hanh (Thay) presents the essentials of Buddhist teachings in a clear, compassionate, and concise manner. In addition to covering teachings at the core of all Buddhist traditions, Thay also covers many key Mahayana Buddhist teachings. In all discussions, Thay helps guide us to the heart of what the Buddha taught; the transformation of suffering into peace, joy, and liberation.

First released in 1999, "The Heart of the Buddha's Teachings" has become a classic and essential read for anyone interested in learning more about basic Buddhist teachings. The book is widely available in bookstores and libraries in print, ebook form, and audio book form.


For the March 24th meeting, please read Chapters 23 and 24.

Discussion points include:

-What is a living being (according to Buddhism)?


-A brief overview of spiritual powers.

***

Happy reading and we hope to see you soon!
results.name: Beginner Buddhist Book Circle

results.description:
Hi Everyone,


It’s meetup season again! It’s been almost a year since we last met and there has been a lot of exciting movement in the email marketing space. It’s time to catch up.

Please join us for an evening of food, drink, and networking as we discuss some of the emails marketing campaigns you submit for review.

As always, there will be beer and pizza followed by hearty round of speed networking so you get to meet everyone in the room. From there, we’ll jump into the review.

If you have thoughts or suggestions on how to make this group even better - or are interested in helping - please stop by and get to know everyone.

For the email review - we're going to take the opportunity to use the brain trust in the room and share email marketing campaigns and offer one thing we like, one thing that could be improved and general feedback. This will be a friendly, constructive session :simple_smile: If you're interested in sharing an email for review please just submit it here:

results.description:
This is an opportunity to practice Japanese conversation, and discuss and study the grammar, particles, Kanji, and culture. The topic varies among all these, according to what people are interested in talking about and the natural flow of conversation.

Members of all levels are welcome, from absolute beginners on up, and there is never a prerequisite. Native speakers are also encouraged to attend, both to lend their expertise and to receive the benefit of a look at the structure of Japanese from an outside linguistic perspective.

Here's a photo of the area where we meet, for reference:

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

The meeting is free, with no membership dues, hourly costs, or other expenses.

 

==> Learning & Practice RESOURCES

Various materials http://www.meetup.com/Japanese-Culture/messages/boards/thread/3199165/0#[masked]

KANJI http://www.meetup.com/Japanese-Culture/messages/boards/forum/1175397
KATAKANA http://www.meetup.com/Japanese-Culture/messages/boards/forum/1198386
HIRAGANA http://www.meetup.com/Japanese-Culture/messages/boards/forum/1198387

Please click over DISCUSSIONS ->Message Board, then select your favorite topic. Have a lot of FUN learning about Nihon & Nihongo! http://www.meetup.com/Japanese-Culture/messages/boards/

results.description:
6:30 pm  Doors open for refreshments & networking


7:00 pm  1010data CTO, Joel Kaplan: "An Idiosyncratic Look at the History of Array Languages." 

7:40 pm 1010data Distinguished Developer, and chief kibbitzer, Stevan Apter will expand on Joel's talk drawing on his experience as a co-author of the A+ programming language and as a member on the original k language design team.

Bios:

Joel Kaplan is a 40-year veteran of the technology and financial services industries, Joel is widely recognized as a technology innovator on Wall Street. Before co-founding 1010data, Joel was Managing Director and head of research and technology for all non-equity trading at UBS North America. Before that Joel was Managing Director and head of Global Fixed Income Research and Technology at Morgan Stanley after having led their Analytical Proprietary Trading Group (APTG), renowned for being the first to employ scientific methodologies to uncover and exploit inefficiencies in the stock market. Under his leadership, the APTG traded as much as two percent of the New York Stock Exchange's daily volume because of the high degree of real-time automation it provided. Earlier in his career, Joel spent eight years at IBM, where he was responsible for research, systems engineering and front-office analytics systems.

Stevan Apter has more than 40 years experience in programming, including using Fortran, APL and Assembler for the United States Antarctic Research Program in the 70's. Joining Morgan Stanley in 1988, the same year Arthur Whitney joined, he was the co-author of A+, Morgan Stanley's proprietary APL interpreter with Arthur. While working at UBS in the 90's he was on the k language design team along with Don Orth and assisted Arthur in the design, implementation, documentation, and application of k1, k2, and k3. Stevan is the author of "K: Remarks on Style, the industry standard style-guide for K programmers. http://nsl.com/papers/style.pdf." In the years since leaving Morgan Stanley Stevan has held a number of senior programmer positions in financial services firms and has created numerous complex systems using several technologies, including kdb+, q and k. He joined 1010data in 2015.
results.name: An idiosyncratic look at the history of array languages

The focus of this group is on fiction, non-fiction and screenwriting. It is open to all, from beginner to advanced. Meeting nights will revolve between nights of writing together, nights of critique, and/or nights of discussion. Topics of discussion will include writing craft, the business of writing and the writers life. Introductions, individual goals and itinerary for future meetings will be discussed this first evening.

Whether you need a night away from the home front to focus on your writing among other writers, a venue where you can network with others to help navigate the self-publishing world, or someplace you can go to have your writing critiqued as you work your way through the rough spots, this group is designed to be a valuable resource for those looking to leave their DDJ (dreaded day job) to pursue a full time writing career.

Looking forward to seeing everyone there.

results.description:
Join us for an introductory dive into Ruby, a beginner-friendly language used on servers in backend web development (i.e., the stuff that goes on between entering a URL and getting a web page back). In this workshop, we will walk you through the basics of the Ruby language and how to use it to set up a basic web server.

Key Takeaways: 

All the tools you need to get up, running and coding with Ruby
Ruby syntax for basic programming concepts like variables, loops, methods, strings, arrays and hashes
The basics of how the World Wide Web works under the hood
Setting up a simple web server and sending HTML pages to a browser
Using your server to interact with Twitter via its API


Prerequisites and Preparation: 


Please bring your own laptop (Mac, PC or Chromebook).
Please download and install Sublime Text (Hint: the download button is on the home page).

*Light snacks will be provided. 

**This event is open to adult (18+) beginners and is an introduction to concepts covered more deeply in the immersive program.
results.name: Ruby for Beginners

[The following was published here on Thursday, 24 March 2016, at 12:15 PM.] 



HEY, SYNERGIST!


TONIGHT, we'll be brainstorming a special HEALTH MAKER LAB event that we hope to produce in June. Come join-in with your good ideas and advice --- at CityScience in DUMBO starting at 6:30 PM this evening.

For those of you who can't physically attend, we'll be Livestreaming---via the good efforts of our Community-Member & Videographer, Marcin Kulesza.

Here is the Livestream link. (We'll hope to put up the 'Stream after 6:45 PM.)


TONIGHT'S LIVESTREAM LINK

As ever, we'll be updating you via slide deck.

Looking forward to "seeing" you this evening!

Best regards!

LAND

+++

[The following was published here on Thursday, 17 March 2016, at 1:45 PM.] 


As an "Executive Summary" reader-orientation “tool,” here is our current HML-design Floor Plan:



HEALTH MAKER LAB, INC.

A New Not-for-Profit Empowering Citizen-Scientists to Help Solve Health & Healthcare Problems at the “MakerRoots” of Local Communities (Our Short-Form Mission Statement)

An Executive Summary

We have worked with innovative concepts, breakthrough technologies and new perspectives in program positioning to design our Not-for-Profit Health Maker Lab, Inc. (HML). Our “Big Tent” goal is to bring together, integrate and drive New York City’s prime assets of Healthcare, the Maker Movement and geographic placement for hyper-local Health betterment. Here are some reasons why NYC is THE locus for our initiative:

·  With 55 major medical centers, NYC is the nation’s prime venue for the practice of Healthcare delivery.

·  Our City’s Metropolitan Area enjoys the largest agglomeration of Higher Education Institutions in the country---many of these offer Life Science degrees.

·  Digital Fabrication (“DigiFab”) is the Fourth Disruptor: (1) PC; (2) Internet; (3) Social Media; (4) DigiFab (including 3D Printing).

·  NYC is the center of DigiFab development in the U.S. and the Healthcare sector is the fastest growing segment in booming DigiFab worldwide.

·  DigiFab has helped coalesce and now drives the Maker Movement---with its democratization of empowerment via “open” source, DIY and DIT (“Do It Together”) communities.

·  With over 25 Maker/Hacker spaces, places and labs, NYC is America’s largest center for Maker venues.

·  Our City is also home to the annual World Maker Faire, the second-largest gathering of Makers in the country (most recently, 95K attendees during two days in September 2015).

Furthermore, HML will be the world’s first Health Science laboratory---open to the general public---that will also serve as an Experiential Destination. As such, we will welcome---and delight!---seekers of hands-on knowledge about the present and prospective state of Health and Healthcare inspiration, systems and solutions in NYC and the U.S.

As the premier U.S. Life-Science "hub” and epicenter of DigiFab & 3D Printing, NYC has joined the network of the new, Ultra-Urban, Manufacturing renaissance. In our nation now, making hardware (pro-actively disruptive, digitally engined and software-modulated) IS returning “on-shore.” Taking all our City synergies into account, NYC is the perfect venue for creating the HQ of America's DigiFab-driven Healthcare Cluster. 

Thus, we are confident in our HML positioning as a new kind of “public” Lab, community Health center and Life Science Experiential Destination.

"Think" of our Health Maker Lab as a LifeSci TechShop + Bio-Exploritorium cum permanent Healthcare Maker Fair. HML is designed to deliver the action, the buzz and the traffic that will compel continual engagement with our target audiences.

As a unique Experiential Destination, HML will offer its neighborhood Sponsor/Donors a distinctive means to differentiate themselves. (For venture-capital players, HML will also present a Healthcare-hardware “accelerator” housing the most exciting and promising Life-Sci startups in the City.)

As Health Maker Lab’s Founder & Executive Director, I would be delighted to exchange with interested parties about our HML Program---and a mutual focus on social commerce and common-good for the Health betterment of local communities in NYC.

Sincerely,

Land Grant

Copyright Land Grant 2016. All rights reserved. Confidential & Proprietary. Contact: Land@NYC3DP. com


[End]

+++

[The following was published here on Thursday, 3 March 2016, at 10 PM.] 

Hi, Synergist!

Just a quick note to ask you to Save The Date---Thursday, 24 March, 6:30 PM---for our March "HCx3DP Meetup NY." At CityScience in DUMBO. Continuing our Community Workshopping of Health Maker Lab. Come on and help!

LAND 

Founder, 3DP Media & 
Health Maker Lab


+++

[The following was published here on Wednesday, 17 February 2016, at 11:30 AM.] 

OK, Fellow Synergist! 

I'm delighted to advise that we're presenting our ambitious Health Maker Lab "Floor Plan" at this evening's Meetup Event. 

To give you a "flavor taste," here's a zoom-in on our HML HEALTH CENTRAL---the heart and hub of our physical spaces. All our other HML activities and Action Centers are clustered around Health Central---which is completely surrounded by a kind of "ring" hallway that accesses other core areas. 

[Copyright Land Grant 2016. All rights reserved.]

You'll see Health Central sub-titled "HML's Community Hub, Creativity Lounge & Coffee House." We've labeled some of Central's key stations (clockwise from upper right): IDJ (Idea DiskJockey), Power Bar (refreshments & food), Healthnographer (idea capture) and Beans & Balls (relaxed cogitation and conversation). 

These are just some of the novel HML concepts we'll unveil and explain this evening. 

As ever, we'll be hoping to elicit your good critiques and added-value ideas.

WeWork Tech---our co-host---is graciously providing beer and pizza this evening. We pledge to feed you body and mind and spirit...come join-in!!

LAND 

Founder, 3DP Media & 
Health Maker Lab

[Please let me repeat a couple of important PS.s...]

PS. If you've yet to make it out to one of our rich content, radical context Meetups, consider this one. We will have a number of "guests" in from WeWork Labs at Dumbo Heights. These are early-stage 'Preneurs who are curious about what we're doing in the LifeSci space. After all, the folks we're collaborating/co-hosting with at the WeWork Tech Meetup enthused: "Wow, very interesting meetup!" So, we'll be orienting HML newbies with a bit of prolog...come get caught up!

PPS. Please RSVP and kindly donate your nominal admission fee---$20---on this event page. (Say, if you can't make it this time---but still believe our efforts are worthy of support---try "Chipping In" via the green donate-button in our left SideBar. Every tangible gesture of approval---however denominated---keeps us moving ahead: socially, psychologically AND financially!) 

[End]



+++

[The following was published here on Tuesday, 16 February 2016, at 3 PM.] 

Hi, Synergist! 

One of the great means to spread the Health Maker Lab "word" is to catch the (editorial) "eye" of an important media platform.

Well, earlier this afternoon, Technical.ly Brooklyn---part of the stable of mostly Mid-Atlantic "Technical.ly covered" cities---published a piece on HML entitled:

"Why these citizen-scientists are launching a nonprofit maker lab focused on health!"

Corporate Technical.ly's tagline is "Better cities through technology." As a mantra, most of you---I suspect---could happily chant along with that informed sentiment. And, that, too, is what Health Maker Lab is all about. Health and Healthcare betterment for our diverse citizenry in Brooklyn and NYC at large.

Enjoy the read. You'll see that are new and informative ideas in the story. (Hey, it's a "guest post;" and as a journo, I wrote it myself...with care, added-value and enthusiasm!)

Hope to see you at our February Meetup tomorrow (17 Feb) evening. We're unveiling our HML "Floor Plan"...a serious MILESTONE---revelatory and disruptive! Come join-in!


LAND 

Founder, 3DP Media & 
Health Maker Lab

[Please let me repeat a couple of important PS.s...]

PS. If you've yet to make it out to one of our rich content, radical context Meetups, consider this one. We will have a number of "guests" in from WeWork Labs at Dumbo Heights.
