+++

[The following was published here on Friday, 12 February 2016, at 8 AM.] 

Good (and gelid) Morning, Synergist!


Maybe you should just burrow down deeper under your covers... And, muse on how we're going to educate, entertain and inspire you at our up-coming Health Maker Lab-centric meetup... (That's Wednesday, 17 February at WeWork Dumbo Heights.)

+++

Last night I was out in my fur-hood-up parka to Jonathan Hirschman's latest MakeIt NYC Meetup. We convened at the new and nifty Impact Hub New York. This is a CoWorker by day that does events in the evening---on Broadway just south of Canal in Manh. 

Jonathan and MakeIt NYC curated a great event with five Maker-centric presenters---including my old chum (and newest Health Maker Lab Advisory Council member) JF Brandon of BotFactory. 

JF is Marketing Guru of BotFactory Inc. (I also consider Meister Brandon to be one of the geniuses of the early 3DP movement here in NYC.) BotFactory is the BK-born & bred (mothered by NYU-Poly) PCB---Printed Circuit Board, for you LifeSci folks---factory on your desktop. (Think "3D printing" your entire circuit---including traces, solder paste and pick-&-place of components---via their Squink product: YOWZA!) 

Almost every hardware device in existence now aspires to built-in intelligence, robotic inclinations and IoT (Internet of Things) "cloudy" connectivity. Most of those attributes reside on a circuit board. So, the flexibility, speed, iterative-ness and security of rolling your own component-laden PCB is a major advantage in such overweening challenges as Time To Market...

+++


Since you're known by the company you keep, please let me update you on our Health Maker Lab Advisory Council.

In the Not-for-Profit world---when you're a newly launched NfP "startup"---your sponsor-able bona fides include the quality of your true believers and proactive adherents. Ours ARE outstanding...and we're honored to enjoy their attention, support and faith in our mission. 

Here is our current (and growing!) official Advisory Council list (in alphabetical order):

HML’s unique marketplace-positioning presents LabFan-program participants with targeted and effective means to access our segments’ decision-makers. While, at the same time, enhancing the well-being of many NYC local and City-wide communities. HML's LabFan Donor-Starter Promo Kit.

Please let me outline how LabFan would work---for both our organizations---via our latest introductory Outline here.

Become a "LabFan" Leader: Gain from Founding-LabFan participation in support of HML development via PR, promotion and positioning within our innovative Program:

(A.)  Get involved and inspired (see specifics below): garner business gains (hard and soft) from our HML community's social commerce and common-good advancement.

(B.)  Help grow our HML Community (for your benefit and ours): make attendance at our events free for HML participants via donations by your LabFan Leader organization.

(C.)  Build interest, base and clout for both our innovative HML Program AND your LabFan organization.

(D.)  Micro support delivers Macro fostering: Join us---early and cost-effectively---at $500 per month for three months of trial LabFan status. (Want even more compelling terms? Invest three months up front for $1,275---instead of $1,500 over three months.)

(E.)  After three months, decide whether a deeper relationship with HML is important to your organization's goals. Then---if we've build goodwill with you---consider moving up to an appropriate "Founding" Donor level.

+++

+++

As promised in Item (A.) above, here are our initial "specifics" of "HML LabFan Donor Features ->>> Benefits"---delivering benefit/ROIs of customer-goodwill and more---to early-adopter/trial Donor "LabFans": 

(1) HML LabFan-Community positive public positioning ->>> LabFan-participating Organizations will enjoy appropriate showcasing as a leader in the innovative HML Community; 

(2) Appropriate promotion on HML Web site or custom SocMed Community site ->>> regular "collaborator" spotlighting of LabFan support for HML Community interests;

(3) Supported LabFan Web-site page or Hosted Social Network/SocMed exposure ->>> LabFan-created appropriate/curated showcasing for HML Community promo purposes;

(4) LabFan created & delivered (HML-curated, hosted & intro'ed) presentations at HML events ->>> enables LabFan added-value "story-telling" for HML Community betterment;

(5) LabFan Member-created & manned Mini-Exhibit tabletop displays at HML events ->>> enables LabFan added-value product & service "Show & Tell" for HML Community delight;

(6) LG provides LabFan-appropriate media coverage ->>> depending on LabFan Organization news "production," LG will freelance articles to sector-selected media vehicles, at one per month;

(7) LG provides LabFan eIntros to appropriate players in the "Big Tent" HML marketplace ->>> LG knowledge of player interests promises relationship-development matchmaking;

(8) LabFan Org-sponsored (added cost to participants) & HML-led Tours of Meetups, Maker Spaces & Facilities of HML-Community Interest ->>> primary field-research & relationship building.

+++

Dear Synergist, I hope you have found our LabFan Program introduction above---"LabFan" Leader outline and LabFan Donor-Starter Promo Kit "Features & Benefits"---compelling. Especially for the very-low, early-adopter/Donor cost. Plus, the added opportunity to be involved---at our Health Maker Lab “kick-off”---in an innovative and promising program for better commercial and common-good Health futures for all our involved communities.

---LG

(E) Meeting, on 11 January, with NYU-Tandon at MetroTech Center, Downtown BK ---

I met with the NYU-Tandon's (new name of the NYU {née Polytechnic} School of Engineering) Vice Dean for Research, Innovation and Entrepreneurship Kurt Becker---and an old friend---on Monday, 11 January. 

I had multiple goals for this meeting. And, a concluding slide-full of "asks!" But, my first objective was to interest NYU-Tandon in hosting our physical HML prototype space. In exchange for a novel, turnkey Lab replete with major players, mentors, trainers, lecturers and eTinkers---with strategic Healthcare disciplines, innovations, equipment and an accelerator---open to his Tandon community.

I think that a Higher Ed Institution (HEI) is a natural venue-partner for our HML prototype. If NYU-Tandon passes on this opportunity, we have---literally!---10 other HEIs in Downtown Brooklyn. Next in line would probably be CUNY NY Tech followed by LIU... In the meantime, Kurt and I are continuing our discussions around the specific common-interests we identified on 11 January. And, our HML "Asks!"

(F) This last week, I had another principal-to-principal Partner/Donor Meeting with a 3DP player AND a very rich experience with Genspace---one of their public "Entrepreneur Talks" and exchanges thereafter about mutual interests (I love this pioneering and innovative LifeSci organization!) ---

As these fertile matters develop, I'll be back to fill you in.

---LG

[The following was published here 3 December 2015.] 

Okay, Would-Be Synergist! Yep, I'm addressing those of you---among our 200 members---who have yet to get personally involved since you "signed up" here with "HCx3DP Meetup NY." 

This is still our official name...even though we've invested the last seven or eight months in a key, innovative subset of "HCx3DP..." That is "Health Maker Lab"---HML, for short.

Bear with me! In this update, I'm going to present additional (compelling!!) reasons for you to commit more of your time and attention to HML. I think in many cases, your free-will commitment likely comes down---in the main---to the appeal of our evolving strategies. And, how---despite this world full of so much choice---they complement your own interests .

Fair enough. Since some of you joined our Meetup Community, we HAVE changed our targets and readjusted our focus. Health Maker Lab is BOTH broader and narrower than HCx3DP. 

Broader in that we've expanded "3DP" to Digital Fabrication---or, DigiFab. You know as well as I that tech of every kind is evolving at lightning speed. 3D Printing is an important subset of DigiFab---especially when applied to Healthcare solutions. BUT, there are effective ways and means beyond 3DP to deliver those novel and necessary answers. Especially if we're thinking "Big Tent."

Narrower in that we've drilling down to determine the most effective of our ultimate HML solutions. Those solutions that will best meet the needs of specific patient, client or recipient communities for improved health---in a larger compass of that phrase. From our HML Community to the larger local community by narrowing our "envisioning" to integrate appropriate solutions. Even if they are NOT the traditional modes of "modern" medicine.

Big Tent---

Now---as this post's title suggests---our HML operational strategy includes putting up a Big Tent and inviting disparate interests (yours!) to enter in expectation and join in our convocation successfully. At this point, we will be hard put to keep our internal HML Action Centers to eight or 10. And, to address the needs of "only" five or six external neighborhood partner or player populations. 

Internally, diverse Action Centers will promote the cross-pollination of new and novel ideas. Leading to what we hope are effective hybrid solutions in Healthcare. 

Externally, serving the varied needs of sometimes competing neighborhood interest groups and organizations ("Hood Hubs!") WILL add to the complexity of our interfaces, relationships and connections. Human interactions ARE usually "messy." (As Miss Frizzle of "The Magic School Bus" admonishes those who would produce scientific creativity: "Take chances; make mistakes; get messy.") We will have to inform our out-facing perspectives with common-good POVs commonly shared.

GeoPrint---

Our HML "action footprint" on the maps of our overlapping communities---our GeoPrint---are likely to be rather fluid. Especially to start. The interests of our HML Community, donors and partners and Healthcare recipients will ensure some curious GeoPrint "gerrymandering." At least until we can rationalize our efforts---from (eventually) adequate resources.

Our startup GeoPrint will (likely!) center in Brooklyn---the "Techreative" Borough. Our initial home-base will (likely!) reside in the Brooklyn Tech Triangle (BTT). That's DUMBO (the City's official "Digital District"), the Brooklyn Navy Yard (335 tech-driven startups and ramp-ups) and Downtown Brooklyn (14 higher ed institutions and 60K students). A rich stew of assets that will help us to launch successfully. (I've lived and worked in Brooklyn for over 35 years and I can vouch for its base of resources---in our pursuit of a new kind of Health.) 

From the BTT, we'll (likely!) spread in Brownstone and Riparian (East River) BK and east into UltraUrban East New York and Brownsville. Neighborhoods of high health needs. NYC enjoys 55 major Healthcare facilities. The self-selected among these will act as our first Hood Hubs among equals. We are---after all---focused on Health and hospitals strive to deliver that uncommon commodity.

Donors and partners---action resources---may drive the expansion of our GeoPrint in unpredictable directions. It is possible that interested players in northern New Jersey could influence our development there---before, say, The Bronx or Staten Island. Certainly, the TriState Region is a natural GeoPrint extension for HML. After that...the world?!!

Viral Ecosystem---

Health Maker Lab is intent on prototyping its inspirations, ideas and innovations in an initial "sandbox" location. We'll play with the combinations that fascinate and foster the most promising solutions to diverse needs. The most  certain possibilities are the certainty of the unexpected. 

As an antidote to negative results, we will call on our Advisory Council (eventually 15 in number) of proven players. These advisors---the bases for our Action Centers---will keep us progressing appropriately to a stable ecosystem at our first HML location.

At that breakout point, we envision a kind of viral HML "reproduction" regimen will commence. Successful ways and means, models and modes and---most importantly---trained and experienced cadre will empower rapid growth (likely?) within New York City.

+++

These expectations will indeed require good people to achieve. Thus, we need YOU to become an active Synergist for Health Maker Lab success. Get excited; get psyched; get into action!

+++

Please join-in our 15 December Meetup (RSVP and contribute here). Learn more about our Health Maker Lab strategic overview in person. Come find your personal reason(s) to become an active member of our Community. Move us ahead...

Best!

LAND, Organizer       
HCx3DP Meetup NY   
& Founder, Health Maker Lab

+++

[End]

KitSplit // Lisbeth Kaufman, Co-founder

KitSplit is a private rental marketplace for on-demand creative tools, like high-end cameras, drones, and virtual reality filming rigs. Called “the AirBNB of cameras” by Forbes and Fast Company, they connect companies and people who own gear with those looking to rent. 

Viosk // Alex Romanovich, Founder & CEO 


Viosk is a new cloud-based video animation & automation platform, allowing businesses & professionals to animate content at lower cost in less time.

YouNow // Dorian Dargan, Sr Product Manager 

YouNow fuses the experience of broadcasting, gaming, performing and social networking, giving direct power to the people and enabling them to discover and create new kinds of interactive content in real-time.

Penguin Random House // John Clinton, Sr Director, Digital Video 

Penguin Random House's John Clinton shares the digital video strategy of the famed and respected publishing house as well as some examples of videos from across their site ecosystem!

results.description:
Join us for Reikishare--No experience required.

$15 at the door

Reikishare is a chance to get together for camaraderie, meditation, learning and energy.

Reiki is a Japanese method of hands-on healing that promotes deep relaxation and stress reduction. As humans, it is our birthright to be able to heal with our hands. So there is no need for training or attunement in order to participate. Reiki helps us channel the frequencies of divine light and love to others. Working together we raise the vibration of all who participate.

Our agenda for the evening will be a brief meditation, followed by discussion. Then everyone present will "take a turn on the table," receiving healing energy from all the other participants.

If you have never been to a Reikishare before, it is a must-try experience. You'll keep coming back every month to find calm, peace, grounding and maybe even enlightenment!

All are welcome! Please RSVP to let me know you are coming. You can buy your ticket here: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/reikishare-tickets-21140990271 or pay $15 at the door.

Hope to see you there!!!

THE NEW JERSEY LGBT CHAMBER OF COMMERCE IS PROUD TO RECOMMEND THAT YOU ATTEND OUR SISTER-CHAMBER'S MONTHLY MIXER ON MARCH 24TH AT THE NEW YORK BOTANICAL GARDEN.

There will be an NGLCCNY Private reception beginning at 6:30PM and then all guests are welcome to attend The New York Botanical Garden's legendary, annual Orchid Show. 

This high-energy event brings Chamber members and guests together for quality networking and community building.   Don't miss this opportunity to forge connections with NY Chamber members, corporate partners and non-profit leaders on the other side of the Hudson River.  

Admission is complimentary to all annual dues-paying Chamber members.  All non-members will be charged $20.  The New York Chamber monthly mixers include two and a half hours of networking, light appetizers and beverages.

The Chambers always makes events easy to attend!  Take Metro-North Harlem Line from Grand Central Terminal to the Botanical Garden Station which is right across the street from the entrance to NYBG. 

Staff at the Mosholu Gate will direct you to the Enid A. Haupt Conservatory where the Mixer is held. Chamber Ambassadors will be inside the Conservatory to the left, to register everyone, and take payment if you haven't paid in advance. Attendees will be in the Rainforest Wing for the private portion of the evening. 

To register as a guest and pay $20 in advance click this link:

<a>https://secure2.chambermaster.com/directory/jsp/events/dlg/Public_AddReg.jsp</a>;

This is a FREE yoga class that meets from 6:30 to 8:00 pm, instructed by Chia-Ti Chiu, one of the organizers of this Meetup group.

It is an OPEN LEVEL HATHA FLOW class, appropriate for beginners to advanced students.  There are many variations given to accommodate the different levels of yoga experience.


** You will need to bring your own mat.  There are no yoga mats for rent or use. You can buy yoga mats inexpensively at Marshalls, Filene's Basement, Modells, TJ Maxx, and Target. Many yoga studios also carry a wide range of mats for sale.

IF YOU COME FOR THE FIRST TIME: PLEASE FILL OUT THE REGISTRATION FORM AT THE FRONT DESK. RSVPing on Meetup does not count as Beacon registration.  Your participation and registration helps keep the numbers needed for this program to stay free!


FOR EVERYONE: PLEASE SIGN IN AT THE FRONT DESK CLEARLY AND LEGIBLY

DIRECTIONS:The Beacon Center is located in PS 198. It is an elementary school that takes up the whole block; entrance is on 3rd Ave. The exact address is: 1700 Third Avenue, between 95 & 96 St.

BY SUBWAY: 6 train to 96 St. Walk 1 block East on 96 St to Third Ave. Make a right onto Third Ave.

BY BUS: Third Ave Bus - M101, 102, 103 to 96 St.

Madison Ave Bus - M1, M2,M3, or M4 To 96 St.

Then we mingle again until its time to go. 

We are usually done by 8:30 but those that want to stick around or continue hanging out after the meetup (bubble tea, karaoke, etc) are more than welcome to do so!

results.description:
This is a free group for anyone who enjoys playing board games and would like to make new friends while doing so. No previous knowledge of board games is necessary. We're happy to help newcomers along with how to play, as well as how to plan strategies to win the games.  

Our event is every Thursday night at Dave & Buster's in Westbury Long Island from 6:30pm to 10:30pm.  You can leave prior to 10:30pm if you want, also please note that Dave & Buster's closes at Midnight for those who want to stay later. 

Most people arrive at 6:30pm.  We use the first 30 minutes to talk, order food/drinks, and pick out games while we wait for any people that are a little late.  Promptly at 7pm we split into groups and play our games that typically take 2 hours to play.  So, if you arrive after 7pm there is a good chance that you will not be able to get into a game and can watch us play if you'd like.  At the end of the night we play a couple of additional shorter games that you can get into.

This group meets in the Large Dining Room at the table directly in front of the wall with 9 Big Screen TV's (We are located 1 room over from the pool tables).  There is no cover charge to enter Dave & Buster's and plenty of parking is available. Also, there is no fee to join this meetup group. All that management at Dave & Buster's asks is that each person purchase $5 off their menu (it can be 1 appetizer, or 1 dessert, or a few sodas, basically whatever you choose).  

Plenty of board games will be present at this event, but feel free to bring some of your favorites. Some of the games that we play are Kingsburg, Stone Age, Lords of Waterdeep, Istanbul, Ticket to Ride, Carcassonne, Castles of Mad King Ludwig, Love Letter Batman, Splendor, Pirate's Cove, Five Tribes, Castles of Burgundy, and more.  

Here is a list of the board games I own on the BGG website: 

https://boardgamegeek.com/collection/user/MarkNY8?own=1&subtype=boardgame&ff=1

Here is a list of Co-Host Kenny's games on BGG: 

https://boardgamegeek.com/collection/user/kenk1982?own=1&subtype=boardgame&ff=1

Looking forward to meeting you. 

Mark
results.how_to_find_us: This group meets in the Large Dining Room at the table directly in front of the wall with 9 Big Screen TV's.   We are 1 room over from the pool tables.

results.description:
In four years of beer club, there's one borough we haven't visited. The Rock, or as it's commonly known, Staten Island.

That will change on March 24 when intrepid beer drinkers will journey to Flagship Brewing!

Your host for this event will be our Staten Island expert, Andrew. The ferry ride takes about a half hour and the brewery is about a 15 minute walk. The brewery doesn't serve food but you can bring some or order in from local restaurants.

If you would like to go as a group, Andrew will be under the ferry terminal welcome sign just after the escalator (picture below) wearing one of our beer club t-shirts. He will be there at 5:45 and will gather the group to head over on the next ferry. Please note the Staten Island Ferry is free so do not buy "discount ferry tickets" from the hucksters outside.

If you're thinking about the return trip, ferries run every half hour for the trip back to Manhattan. It would be great if we could get a big group over to the Rock to check out one of NYC's newest breweries.

Hope to see you in Staten Island!

Cheers,

Andrew and Bill

results.description:
In situations of conflict, we tend to become angry easily. We even think anger will help us ‘win’ our battles, and we rely on it as if it were our trusted friend. The mind of anger, however, leaves a trail of broken relationships, lost opportunities, and painful feelings in its wake. In this class, we will learn to use Buddha’s skillful techniques to remain balanced, flexible and peaceful in the midst of difficult circumstances, thereby overcoming our real enemy, the painful mind of anger itself. It is not enough to simple KNOW anger is a negative force in our lives, we need to see it for ourselves. It is only when we understand the dangers of anger that we actually develop the internal power to oppose and reduce its effects. In this series, we will learn to meditate on anger and patience, discovering how to transform a disturbed, turbulent mind into a peaceful attitude that will enable us to solve our conflicts and leave us feeling peaceful and focused.

The classes will include instruction, guided meditations and discussion. The mind-training methods taught in this course include meditation and meditation break exercises; these are tried-and-tested methods which can be practiced by anyone–regardless of prior experience.  Give yourself and your loved ones the gift of a patient mind

During this session, we'll be discussing testing at potential employers; what to expect, how to prepare, etc. I will also be bringing a few "test" test images, for anyone who is interested (bring a drive if you want the files!). I have created four product test images, as well a skin test image, for you to "test" on. Each image assesses different skills, must be submitted fully layered, and will be subject to a time limit. If you decide to try it, you can either bring your completed test image(s) to our next meetup for review, or send it to me via WeTransfer (or similar).


Please be aware when you RSVP that if you say you will be in attendance, and then do NOT show up– WITHOUT updating your RSVP to reflect your inability to attend– you will be fined $10. If you are a no-show (meaning you say you'll attend and don't show up without changing your RSVP) three times, you will be dismissed from the group.

There is no penalty for changing your RSVP (BEFORE the scheduled meetup). So if you say you'll come, and then you can't make it, simply change your RSVP to "no"; no harm done. Please just be respectful with your participation (or lack thereof). Thanks!

results.description:
Pope Francis' encyclical on climate change galvanized many people to a new level of awareness on the moral necessity of addressing the climate crisis.

"Laudato Si" challenges the communities of science, ethics, justice, economics, and religion to imagine an integral ecology based upon compassion and environmental knowledge.

In recognition of this global leadership, you are invited to join a wide range of scientists, musicians, artists, and poets to share perspectives on a multifaceted and holistic path forward for our planet.

SPEAKERS

* Arthur Lerner-Lam - Professor and Deputy Director, Lamont-Doherty Earth Observatory at Columbia University

* David Orr - Professor of Environmental Studies and Politics, Oberlin College

* Elaine Pagels - Professor of Religion, Princeton University

* Mary Evelyn Tucker - Senior Lecturer and Research Scholar at Yale's School of Forestry and Environmental Studies and Divinity School

* Distinguished poets, artists, musicians and writers, including: Jorie Graham, Andrew Sullivan, Scott Chaskey, Timothy Donnelly, Joy Harjo, and more

SPONSORS


The Natural Resources Defense Council, Urban Green Council, , International Center of Photography, The Poetry Society of America, and The Cooper Union Institute for Sustainable Design.

RSVPs

You MUST provide your full name and email address when you RSVP... no exceptions.


You will receive a confirmation email with full event details.


Seating is limited. Do not wait to register.
results.name: Climate Change, "Our Common Home" panel discussion on Pope Francis' Encyclical

results.description:
I'm thrilled to announce that we will be reading All the Birds in the Sky by Charlie Jane Anders in March!

From Goodreads:

Childhood friends Patricia Delfine and Laurence Armstead didn't expect to see each other again, after parting ways under mysterious circumstances during high school. After all, the development of magical powers and the invention of a two-second time machine could hardly fail to alarm one's peers and families.

But now they're both adults, living in the hipster mecca San Francisco, and the planet is falling apart around them. Laurence is an engineering genius who's working with a group that aims to avert catastrophic breakdown through technological intervention into the changing global climate. Patricia is a graduate of Eltisley Maze, the hidden academy for the world's magically gifted, and works with a small band of other magicians to secretly repair the world's ever-growing ailments. Little do they realize that something bigger than either of them, something begun years ago in their youth, is determined to bring them together--to either save the world, or plunge it into a new dark ages.

A deeply magical, darkly funny examination of life, love, and the apocalypse.
results.name: March Book Club - All the Birds in the Sky by Charlie Jane Anders

Presented by Joel Califa, Product Designer at DigitalOcean



Price: $15 for early birds, $20 for regular


I’m a designer, so I should probably learn responsive patterns, methods for remote user testing, Sketch, motion graphics, Framer, keep up to date with current design trends, and so much more.

I’m a developer, so I should probably learn SVG animations, Node or React or Ember, BEM principles, new web inspector features, Vim or at least better Sublime workflows, and so much more.

I’m also a human being, so I can’t possibly learn all these things. I have to choose.

So… what do I choose? Full Stack Anxiety is that creeping doubt, when you just don’t know what the right choice is. Do I grow as a designer or do I grow as a developer? As a manager, a teacher, a business-person? 

In this talk, we’ll explore the feeling, the current state of the industry, and how to figure out where to grow.

Joel Califa teaches front-end development at General Assembly and leads Product Design at DigitalOcean, where he works on strategy, design, and development. Prior to this, he held design positions at Netcraft, Israel's leading interactive agency, and Amicus, a YC-backed startup that helps nonprofits turn their supporters into fundraisers and advocates. 

A graduate of Parsons' Design & Technology program, Joel has been designing and building websites since 2001.


Connect

We post discounts & freebies here:

Our Newsletter • Designers + Geeks Facebook • @DesignersGeeks


Satisfaction Guarantee

We organize this group to promote innovation, creativity, and the benefits of new technology. If you purchase a ticket and aren't happy with the experience, can't make it, or decide that you don't want to support the community for any reason, we're happy to refund your money.

Please note that if you do need to cancel your reservation, we request that you do so at least 24 hours before the event so that the tickets can be shared with others who may be waiting.
results.name: Full Stack Anxiety

results.description:
AngularJS is an open-source Javascript framework, maintained by Google, that assists with running single-page applications. Its goal is to augment browser-based applications with model-view-controller (MVC) capability, in an effort to make both development and testing easier.

Learn the basics of Angular and how to build a simple application while learning about key Angular topics.

Logistics:

Date: March 24, 2016

Time: 7-9:30pm

Price: $25 (Purchase Tickets Here)

Prerequisites

Laptop

Download Sublime Text and Google Chrome

Refund Policy: All refunds must be requested 7 days before the event.
results.name: Get Started with Angular JS

results.description:
To find us please ring the 9th floor for entry

Speaker

Bonnie Eisenman is a Software engineer, author, aspiring polyglot. Member of NYC Resistor and author of Learning React Native.

Description


Learn how React Native can enable you to build high-quality, natively-rendering iOS and Android apps, using a cross-platform JavaScript codebase. I'll discuss what it's like to build applications with React Native, and how it differs from existing cross-platform approaches to writing mobile apps. Attendees will leave with a solid grasp of React Native principles and a sense of whether it's a good choice for their next mobile project.

Useful for anyone who has an interest in React Native or mobile development in general! I'll be discussing React Native at a high level. In particular, mobile developers who have never worked with JavaScript, and JavaScript developers who haven't done much mobile should find the talk useful.


For the curious, Bonnie covers similar issues here

Schedule

• 6:30 doors open

• 6:30-7:30 Happy Hour & Food

• 7:30-8:00 Talk

• 8:00-Closing: Q&A, Networking
results.how_to_find_us: Please ring for the 9th Floor for entry

results.description:
I am hosting a free webinar masterclass on creating a platform that gets your photography noticed.

In this over photographed world, taking pretty pictures isn't enough. Great pictures are everywhere.

In fact, in some ways, great photos aren't even necessary to stand out. Have you ever noticed someone who takes average photos yet attracts a massive following?

If you want people to notice your photography — whether to sell prints, build a business or just increase your following — you need to build a platform.

In my podcasts, I have been talking about platforms and suggesting that you should create one. In this Masterclass, I will walk you through the specific steps. I will even demonstrate some of the difficult principles, so you can see exactly what I mean.

BY THE END OF THE WEBINAR, YOU SHOULD KNOW

• How to evaluate your photography to determine if you are ready

• How to select the best niche for you

• How to choose a name for your photography

• How to create an online presence

• How to build your photography blog

• What you should photograph and write about to make it interesting

• How to network in a way that is authentic and brings results

• How to structure a weekly plan to get this accomplished in just two hours per week

• How to find the support to reach your photography goal

You'll be able to ask questions and interact too if you watch live. If you can't make the live training, you'll be able to watch the replay, but you must register for the webinar to get access. 

The link will be automatically sent out to those who register.

results.description:
Love brazilian music? This workshop is for you!
We'll get to work on classics of bossa-nova, understand the rhythm patterns and learn the finger style technique to master comping and the nuances of brazilian clave.
You'll get familiar with 7th, 9th, 13th, diminish chords.
Nylon string guitar is recommended for this class but you won't get turned away if you bring a steel string guitar.
You must be familiar with open chords and comfortable playing songs and switching chords in time. Barre chord knowledge is a plus but nor required for this workshop.
This is a one hour workshop with the option of performing three songs May 1st at Arlene's Grocery.
Obrigada!

results.description: Oh yes, start think about your silly team names now because we are going back to Trivia Thursday @ The Corkscrew!  Corkscrew does a great Trivia night and their questions cover a wide range of topics.  Last time we were quite competitive with some real trivia pros, but this time we win everything (and have even more fun) ;D.  If you want to dine with us, get there @ 7, otherwise get there @ 7:30.  Parking is generally abundant in that part of town & it is a 7 minute walk from the 9th Street-Congress Street Light Rail station in Hoboken.  Any questions, do not hesitate to send a message.  Get your affirmative RSVP's in ASAP.  See you there!!  ;D

results.description:
Get ready to get happier simply by talking about happiness! We'll be in the cafe. Look for our red Meetup sign. Please feel free to arrive late or leave early. It's great if you can RSVP in advance, but in case you can't, come anyway.

As a reminder, this group has two goals. The first is to explore the relationship between happiness and goodness. The second, much more fun, goal is for us to become much happier just by getting together and talking about happiness. The theory behind this second goal comes from a classic psychology study showing that by simply talking regularly about happiness we can become much happier.

While we'll often have set topics, like gratitude, acts of kindness, meditation and other happiness techniques, the following list of 14 topics will serve as a backdrop for our discussions.

1. Keep busy and be more active
2. Spend more time socializing
3. Be productive at meaningful work
4. Get better organized and plan things out
5. Stop worrying
6. Lower your expectations and aspirations
7. Develop positive, optimistic thinking
8. Become present oriented
9. Develop an outgoing, social personality
10. Work on a healthy personality
11. Be yourself
12. Eliminate negative feelings and problems
13. Close relationships are the number one source of happiness
14. Put happiness as your most important priority.

Here's some background on the research our group is based on.

In 1980 three New Zealand researchers found that after eight 2-hour conversation sessions about happiness over four weeks, their subjects reported a 22 percent increase in their happiness. Continuing their twice-weekly sessions, by the sixteenth week they reported being 42 percent happier.

Our list of topics comes from Fort Myers, Florida psychologist Michael Fordyce's "14 Fundamentals of Happiness." In 1977, Fordyce pioneered the science of happiness-increase with the world's first experiment designed to boost individual happiness.

That's the group, and those are our goals. It's also very, very important that we have fun. With that in mind, let's get ready to get good and happy!

Resources:

For those interested in learning about the major findings from social science research about happiness, and becoming happier, here are links to several excellent peer-reviewed articles that can be downloaded as pdf files for free. (Note: Although these classic articles are somewhat dated, decades of research on happiness reveal that findings on happiness tend to be extremely stable over time.)

Pursuing Happiness: The Architecture of Sustainable Change
By S Lyubomirsky, KM Sheldon and D Schkade, 2005.  21 pages

In Pursuit of Happiness: Empirical Answers to Philosophical Questions
By P Kesebir and E Diener, 2008. 9 pages.

Subjective Well-Being: Three Decades of Progress
By E Diener, EM Suh, RE Lucas and HL Smith, 1999. 27 pages

results.description:
The East River Park track is east of the FDR at East 6th Street. It is a little over a mile from the closest subway stops (6 to Astor Place or L to First Ave).

Thursday workouts change from week to week and will be announced in advance.

Important Information about East River Park Track: The Whippets have been running here for many years and have experienced thefts of our belongings. We will take extra precautions to keep our bags safe, but please avoid bringing valuables -- and it would be safest to run with your wallet on you.

Please be aware that there are limited overhead lights, so it gets a little dark, and during winter months the bathrooms are locked and the water fountains are off. If you have a bike, make sure you have a lock because you'll have to keep your bike outside the track area.

We recommend not bringing valuables to the track. You can drop stuff off at Ace Bar (531 East 5th Street between A and B) -- ask for Justin or Charlo and tell them you run with the team. 


See you there -- and please contact a Whippet captain if you have any questions!
results.how_to_find_us: We meet in a small group just inside the turnstile, or we gather in the track infield near the long jump pit
results.name: East River Park Track Workout

results.description:
3D Thursday 3/24: Liz Arum will show how to make candy molds for chocolate from the things you 3D print. Perfect for holiday treats!

We’ll be making chocolate molds using ComposiMold, Silicone Plastique and Amazing Mold Putty. We’ll also show how to generate a 3D printable molds for an object.

So .... there has been a lot of fuss about this desktop 3D printing revolution thing for a while now. Still very exciting! 

We have a new-old idea that leaps beyond the news hype and celebrates the wonder of the activity itself. Let's get together every Thursday evening to explore this broad field, in all of its many facets and manifestations. And get to know each other better -- from bold pioneers, to new adopters, from teachers to students, manufacturing experts, to code and electronics hackers. This is your space to grow and share.

Topics we might explore on a typical Thursday evening include:

- 3D design software and techniques. From getting started, to pushing boundaries.

- Explore more of the 3D ecosystem, from making use of 3D printing service bureaus to starting and managing your 3D Hub.

- How to prototype and develop your own physical products, tools, and artwork.

- 3D printing materials: strategies for fabricating in more than just 1-2 plastics.

- Casting and mold-making: from precious metals to candy bars.

- Finishing techniques. Sanding, painting, sealing, melting, deforming, decorating, hydro-printing.... Why just make things that look like plastic?

Let's spend time together sorting out better ways to use these tools, and better ways to design.

results.description:
You're invited to join us for this weekly opportunity to sharpen your drawing skills! This session is open to sketchers of all levels.

What makes our sessions different? 

• We start on time in a large, clean, well-lit space. 

• Sketchers can concentrate because our room is quiet while the model is posing.

• We have coffee and cookies at the long break. 

• We finish on time so you can be headed home at 9:00 p.m sharp! 

• (Latecomers can be seated at a break.)


• This is a two hour drawing session to work from a live (nude) model.  

• We start with short 2 minute poses and work up to a 20 minute pose by the end of the session. We take a 5 minute break every 20 minutes. 


• There are seats for everyone tables and several light weight easels. 


• Access to a sink is available for watercolor artist.

• Bring your own materials (no oil or acrylic paint and no sprays please.)

As always if you have any questions please feel free to email me. I look forward to seeing you there. 

Simon

results.description:
RSVP Link: 

https://nycceopitchnight.splashthat.com/

Are you looking for a real, thrilling pitching event?

Do you want to improve your pitch skills?

Are you interested in investing in the next star tech companies?

NYCCEO provides an exciting pitch night to the New York tech community by inviting 6 innovative tech startups to present in front of a panel of experienced VC and entrepreneur judges. This is a live opportunity to see how the CEOs pitch their startup ideas within 5 minutes, get challenged, and frame their answers in Q&A.

Everyone is their own judge—come to hear from some of the most innovative minds in the tech space  and meet your dream team at NYCCEO’s pitch night! 


Time: 3/24 Thursday 7:00 – 9:00 pm.

Ticket Link: https://nycceopitchnight.splashthat.com/

Food and drinks will be provided during the networking sessions following the presentation. 


Presenting

1.

Advisely—Get valuable advice from your neighborhood

• A neighborhood Q&A app

• Use your neighborhood resources and get help you wouldn’t expect

2.

Fives—Your friends, your plans, the city is at your fingertip

• Change the way you socialize

• Non-traditional social platform and goes beyond your intimate circle


3.

Shareflo—Rent or buy, nearby  

• A seamless mobile platform to rent or buy

• $32bn addressable market size

4.

Sheetkraft—Automate business process on speadsheets

• For companies who struggle to aggregate data from multiple sources

• Build automate data flow operation system

5.

Docflight﻿ - Top American doctors at your fingers

• Provides services including video consultation, expert opinion, and travel to US treatment. 

• Eliminate the distance between you and carefully ed physicians from America’s best hospitals and medical schools, including: Harvard, Yale, John Hopkins, Cleveland Clinic, Mayo Clinic, Columbia, Stanford and more

6.

Bright Water - Data-driven small business lead gen and credit profiles

• Leverage data technology to build products that solve information asymmetry problems in Chinese financial market

Moderator

Zong Zhong Peng

Zong Zhong Peng is a member of the CEO's office at TIAA, where he works on strategy development and strategic acquisition opportunities for the firm's various businesses.

Prior to TIAA, Zong had a variety of entrepreneurial and analytical experience, including three start-ups, brief stint at two long/short hedge funds, corporate development at McGraw-Hill Financial (Capital IQ), and tech strategy consulting at Accenture. With his first start-up, He cofounded an investment education/trading software venture, and recently advised a micro-insurance start-up in Fiji Islands.  Zong received his MBA from Columbia Business School and BA from the University of Maryland.

Judges

Roger Chen

Roger is a Principal with Genacast Ventures where his responsibilities include evaluating investment opportunities, sourcing new deals, and managing the growth of existing portfolio companies.

Prior to joining Genacast, Roger worked for Google as a PM on the Local AI team, where he led big data initiatives for Maps. He also spent time scaling SecOps teams in Maps and Chrome. In addition, Roger has been a consultant to several PE/VC firms, supporting investment diligence efforts with industry and technical knowledge. Roger earned his BS from the University of Michigan and his MBA from The Wharton School.

Shaw Li

Shaw is a Product Manager at CommonBond.co. Prior to joining CommonBond, Shaw worked as a Director at Visa where he was in charge of managing Visa's risk product strategy for helping financial institutions create and implement tools to identify and stop fraudulent transactions in real-time and for developing new products, overseeing product development, and coordinating with sales and operations during product launches. Before working at Visa, Shaw also worked as a Consultant at Accenture, where he managed multi-billion dollar transformation project for multinational agricultural clients. 

Shaw earned a bachelor degree from the University of California, Berkeley, and MBA from Cornell University - Johnson Graduate School of Management.

Catherine Cai

Catheine is an investment professional at Palm Drive Ventures, where her responsibilities include sourcing new deals, conducting due diligence and providing post-portfolio services.

Prior to joining Palm Drive Ventures. Catherine worked in CITIC Trust, Deloitte, and Schneider Electrics, specializing in wealth management, accounting and financial analysis. Catherine earned her Bachelor degree from Guanghua School of Management at Peking University and MPA from Columbia University.

About our partner

Lair East is a New York-based startup community that offers a co-working space, connection to top tier angel/VC investors, and global entrepreneurial network to its members. ﻿


About NYCCEO

Founded in 2012, NYCCEO is one of the largest and most influential cross-border entrepreneurial organizations in New York with a mission to connect the startup communities in China and the U.S. We organize events and establish platforms to connect investors, entrepreneurs, and other members.

In 2015, we organized 14 events featuring leading investors, startups, and major tech companies, and we have grown our active members and social reach by 3 times. Our 2015 special guests include:

Co-founder/CEO of Jet.com, Head of Global Operation from Xiaomi, Partners from IDG, Angel Investor of Didi Dache, Founders and Partners at ZhenFund, Founders of Raven Technology, Co-Founder/CTO WayUp (Campus Job), Founder of Pre-Angel, Founder of Linear Venture, and executives from Pebble, Chengwei Capital, GWC, WeWork, and Indiegogo.

results.description:
Photographer & Model Photoshoot Society Presents:

"Featured Model: Implied & Nude Shoot w/Nina - March 24th"

(Model Spotlight shoots will now be called Featured Model)

After the last weekday shoot success, I'm happy to welcome newcomer to the group, Nina. She is a NYC based model and boutique owner. She is pleasure to work with, gives 110% and is sure to leave a lasting impression with this shoot!

About Featured Model Shoots:

With this type of shoot there will be one model. (Limited smaller group than our bigger shoots) It could be a traveling model, one of our member favorites or a new model with a unique concept. These shoots are designed to be more intricate as far as lighting scheme, concepts and free form. (The freedom to adjust lighting, sets, add props and make the look your own with plenty of time to do so.) We will have a basic starting point for the look but you are encouraged to experiment. (I will be on hand to help where needed.)

About the Shoot:

We have three looks planned with possible fourth look pending time and amount of shooters. First, we'll start up with a lingerie boudoir look. The second look is an implied look. (We'll have a few options available.) The last is a nude look setup. (Glamour nude or art nude.)

RSVP:

We have setup a deposit system to hold a spot for a shoot. So, please only sign up when you are sure of your attendance and ready to make the deposit to hold your spot. (This also lets anyone on a waitlist able to join the shoot if you are not sure of your attendance yet.) Your spot is not held till the deposit is received and I'll send you a confirmation message or confirm your spot on the Meetup page. All deposits need to be received immediately upon signup or within 5 days of the shoot or we will have to fill the unconfirmed spot/s ASAP or cancel the shoot (existing deposits returned) if the minimum RSVP is not met. (No, deposit is needed if you are on the waitlist but check back to see if your waitlist status has been updated to "Yes".)

Total Cost: $80

Deposit: $20 (PayPal)

(Don't mark the checkbox on the PayPal page as that adds the surcharge automatically. If we have to return a deposit for any reason, it will be less than originally deposited.)

Balance due at time of shoot: $60, Cash preferred, Credit Cards/Paypal ok with $5 added for surcharge.

Non-Commercial Release PDF will be emailed to you at the email address given on the sign in sheet.

Model: 

Nina

(Photo Credit: NandoPro)

Policy and Disclaimers:

One-on-One: The model will be available for one half hour one on one shoot after the first two hours in the Meetup. If you want to pre-book time before the shoot, send me a message.

Shared One-on-Ones: We are also implementing a system that has been working for the past few Meetups. It's the sharing of a half hour one on one with a fellow photographer. It can be shared together for the whole half hour or 15 minutes each photographer. 

____________________________________________________________________

About the Studio:

The studios is a beautiful 3,000 sq. ft., climate controlled,  fully functional studio. (Professional in-house lights, props, various seamless backdrops, actual commercial photography sets, kitchen, waiting room, meeting/presentation room, the works!) It's conveniently located to major highways and a 20-30 minute public transportation ride to and from NY.

About The Meetup Format:

We will keep the group small although we have the space to accommodate a big group. This keeps things from feeling rushed and overwhelming. Each photographer will have a set amount of time per look. This will allow you to  shoot as you would in an actual client shoot and not have to worry about the number of shots you are taking. (This proved to be ideal in our previous shoots as far as being able to get "the shot" and enough time to do so. Think of it as a mini one-on-one time with the model.) During the shoot we may opt to give a theme a direction to shoot for. As it would be for an actual client. (Ex: If the setup calls for a "cover shot" then it will give you a direction to aim for and to consider what equipment to use or what mood to capture.) No worries, bring what lens or lenses you have, you'll learn to use what you have for best results. We strive to bring forth real world conditions and parameters so there is a methodology to a setup or theme.

Check-in Procedure and Disclaimers:

Check-in - When you arrive, there will be a quick check-in. This will mostly be so you can read and adhere to the studio/group shoot guidelines and make payment for the shoot before we start. This will also let us send you the release forms in PDF format if we don't have physical copies available.

Releases - We will have one non-commercial release signed by the model through the studio only. (No additional releases will be signed.) If you need a commercial release signed, you can make arrangements with the model directly. Additional compensation for this is between the model and photographer.

Right to Refuse - We have the right to refuse a member's RSVP to the Meetup. It's a small community and models keep detailed info on photographers also. If we feel there is justifiable reason to refuse a RSVP, we will exercise that right.

Signups - Please signup when you know you will attend. If the signup passes the point to book another model and then we get no shows it's not fair to your fellow photographers who would be on a waiting list. It also puts the organizers in a tough spot, financially after booking an additional model to compensate for a bigger group. In case of no show, we will have to remove you from the group. When emergencies come up, followup with an email and we can make exceptions on a case by case basis. 

Deposit - We have implemented a deposit system to insure that the minimum RSVP is met to hold the shoot. (Which varies from shoot to shoot.) This will ensure that the financials are or will be in place for the model/s beforehand. This deposit will be non-refundable, so make sure you sign up and pay the deposit when you are sure you will be able to attend. Signing up to the Meetup page does not ensure your spot until the deposit is made at the Paypal link provided on each event page. As the shoot date comes closer, if you have not paid the deposit, we will fill the unconfirmed spot immediately. You will receive a confirmation message or a confirmation comment on the Meetup page you are signing up for. Two days before the shoot, if the minimum RSVP has not been met then we will opt to cancel the shoot and refund any deposits already sent. This will give the model some time to book another gig if possible. But as usual, always check the Meetup page up to the date of the shoot for any updates.

Model Cancellation - If a model cancels/no show or a last minute model change occurs, you will have the option to cancel beforehand or not attend the Meetup on the day of, if it happens upon arrival to the Meetup. (Any refunds will be given or credit toward a future Meetup as per your request.)

Waitlist - When you are on a waitlist, please be mindful as this is also considered a RSVP of availability. So, if we add another model or someone cancels, your wait list status may upgrade to a "Yes" automatically. Please be on the lookout for updates on the Meetup page as Meetup sometimes takes longer to notify of a status change.

Updates - Updates will be made on this page up to the date of the Meetup or the night before. Emails will also be sent but Meetup emails are not always reliable to be sent to a receiver right away. (I've heard of emails arriving 3 hours later if at all.)

Postponements - Weather considerations will be made the night before a shoot or on the day of and the Meetup page will be updated as well as emails sent if a postponement occurs due to inclement weather or some other emergency. Lack of minimum RSVP to hold the event will also cause postponement of the shoot. The night before we would make the call wether to postpone so be on the look out for our email and Meetup page updates.

Any questions please email me at [masked]
results.name: Featured Model: Implied & Nude Shoot w/Nina - March 24th

results.description:
Multiple award winning, #1 New York Times bestselling author Neil Gaiman returns to dazzle, captivate, haunt, and entertain with this third collection of short fiction following Smoke and Mirrors and Fragile Things—which includes a never-before published American Gods story, “Black Dog,” written exclusively for this volume.

In this new anthology, Neil Gaiman pierces the veil of reality to reveal the enigmatic, shadowy world that lies beneath. Trigger Warning includes previously published pieces of short fiction—stories, verse, and a very special Doctor Who story that was written for the fiftieth anniversary of the beloved series in 2013—as well “Black Dog,” a new tale that revisits the world of American Gods, exclusive to this collection.

Trigger Warning explores the masks we all wear and the people we are beneath them to reveal our vulnerabilities and our truest selves. Here is a rich cornucopia of horror and ghosts stories, science fiction and fairy tales, fabulism and poetry that explore the realm of experience and emotion. In Adventure Story—a thematic companion to The Ocean at the End of the Lane—Gaiman ponders death and the way people take their stories with them when they die. His social media experience A Calendar of Tales are short takes inspired by replies to fan tweets about the months of the year—stories of pirates and the March winds, an igloo made of books, and a Mother’s Day card that portends disturbances in the universe. Gaiman offers his own ingenious spin on Sherlock Holmes in his award-nominated mystery tale The Case of Death and Honey. And Click-Clack the Rattlebag explains the creaks and clatter we hear when we’re all alone in the darkness.

A sophisticated writer whose creative genius is unparalleled, Gaiman entrances with his literary alchemy, transporting us deep into the realm of imagination, where the fantastical becomes real and the everyday incandescent. Full of wonder and terror, surprises and amusements, Trigger Warning is a treasury of delights that engage the mind, stir the heart, and shake the soul from one of the most unique and popular literary artists of our day.
results.name: Read & Discuss "Trigger Warning: Short Fictions & Disturbances" by Neil Gaiman

results.description:
Toastmasters is a place where you develop and grow - both personally and professionally. You join a community of learners, and in Toastmasters meetings we learn by doing. Whether you're an executive or a stay-at-home parent, a college student or a retiree, you will improve yourself; building skills to express yourself in a variety of situations. You'll open up a world of new possibilities: giving better work presentations; leading meetings - and participating in them - more confidently; speaking more smoothly off the cuff; even handling one-on-one interactions with family, friends and colleagues more positively.

In a club meeting, you practice giving prepared speeches as well as brief impromptu presentations, known as Table Topics. There is no rush and no pressure: The Toastmasters program allows you to progress at your own pace.

Constructive evaluation is central to the Toastmasters philosophy. Each time you give a prepared speech, an evaluator will point out strengths as well as suggest improvements. Receiving - and giving - such feedback is a great learning experience. In Toastmasters, encouragement and improvement go hand-in-hand.

Visiting a club is an exciting first step in reaching your goals. There’s no need to feel pressure to participate at your first club meeting – you can simply observe if you wish.
results.name: General Toastmasters Club Meeting

results.description:
Real Self Defense is Offensive in nature. 

KravMaguy offers a true, authentic Israeli Defense Forces (IDF) training experience emphasizing hand-to-hand combat, tactical and warrior training for both men and women. The Head instructor was featured in the History Channel – The Human Weapon- a documentary about Krav Maga in Israel. His last assignment was as Tactical Security Team Leader working off the coast of East Africa. 

In this basics class you will learn to defend yourself and survive knife wielding assassins, sexual assaults or any would be attacker looking to take your life using the basic principles of kravmaguy level one system. In the end only your are responsible for your own protection. You cannot rely on others when split seconds count.

Topics covered in Level One 8 week course:
Jab cross 
Fighting Stance
Weak body spots
Hook uppercut
Basic footwork
Punching jab cross
Elbows regular
Knees
Groin strikes- knees, shin to groin, groin jab (lead leg)
Knife hands
Escape- RNC
Escape guillotine
Escape schoolyard headlock (requires matted area)
Physical requirements to pass level one:
20 pushups
35 sit ups
30 squats
Level 2 training prep


check out this youtube video to see kravmaguy knife defense in action, these techniques are used by murderers and terrorists to kill countless innocents and knowing these basic defenses can save your life and the ones you love

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BbzLjAUlyzU

the eye rake to elbow to the spine: a kravmaguy classic:

results.description:
The Global Financial System (GFS) is saddled with debt of such proportions that there is no visible way out of the trap we have created. The Federal Reserve's balance sheet has grown from 12/23/1913 until September 2008 from "$0" to $750 billion. Between September 2008 and December 2008, the balance sheet swelled to over $3 trillion. Today it is $4.5 trillion. The overall growth has been 515% growth, a rate of change unheard of in the history of fiat currency. This "quantitative easing", courtesy of former Chairman Ben Bernanke, is akin to the US creating a nuclear explosion. The only response the for the rest of the world's central banks - given the reserve currency status of the USD - was to follow suit. This is why some people have suggested that we have been fighting a currency war since QE began. As of the week ending January 30th, the Bank of Japan has moved its official policy rate to negative -0.1%. The Japanese term structure is negative out to seven years. If you are a saver in Japan, this means there is no value in holding Yen. This is the BOJ admitting defeat, and the consequences are unknown. This hasn't happened in a world of fiat currency in the history of mankind.

When something happens that has NEVER happened before, or it only happened a long, long time ago, it is important to take note.

This Salon will discuss:

* How did we get here?
* Why has the US done what it has done?
* What can be done to fix our financial system?
* Are there any steps or actions we as a community should take?

https://www.dropbox.com/s/tr66qzjybwjlc6i/No1_The%20Salon.pdf?dl=0
results.name: Let's meet and talk about the global financial system

results.description:
Skim by Mariko Tamaki and Jillian Tamaki

"Skim" is Kimberly Keiko Cameron, a not-slim, would-be Wiccan goth who goes to a private girls' school in the early '90s. When her classmate Katie Matthews is dumped by her boyfriend, who then kills himself — possibly because he's (maybe) gay — the entire school goes into mourning overdrive. It's a weird time to fall in love, but that's what happens to Skim when she starts meeting secretly with her neo-hippie English teacher, Ms. Archer. But then Ms. Archer abruptly leaves the school, and Skim has to cope with her confusion and isolation while her best friend, Lisa, tries to pull her into "real" life by setting up a hilarious double-date for the school's semi formal. Suicide, depression, love, homosexuality, crushes, cliques of popular, manipulative peers — the whole gamut of teen life is explored in this poignant glimpse into the heartache of being 16.
results.name: NBCBC #46: Skim by Mariko Tamaki and Jillian Tamaki

results.description:
We go to the past to expand our definition of "post-apocalyptic" and the scorched earth effect of the Norman Invasion of 1066, when William the Conqueror was uncompromising and brutal. English society was broken apart, its systems turned on their head. What is little known is that a fractured network of guerrilla fighters took up arms against the French occupiers. 

In The Wake, a postapocalyptic novel set a thousand years in the past, Paul Kingsnorth brings this dire scenario back to us through the eyes of the unforgettable Buccmaster, a proud landowner bearing witness to the end of his world. Accompanied by a band of like-minded men, Buccmaster is determined to seek revenge on the invaders. But as the men travel across the scorched English landscape, Buccmaster becomes increasingly unhinged by the immensity of his loss, and their path forward becomes increasingly unclear.

Written in what the author describes as "a shadow tongue"―a version of Old English updated so as to be understandable to the modern reader―The Wake renders the inner life of an Anglo-Saxon man with an accuracy and immediacy rare in historical fiction. To enter Buccmaster's world is to feel powerfully the sheer strangeness of the past. A tale of lost gods and haunted visions,The Wake is both a sensational, gripping story and a major literary achievement.
results.name: March's Post-Apocalyptic Discussion: Paul Kingsnorth's The Wake

After a long week what could be better than meeting with friends and potential new friends to fold your work week away! Come fold with us at AWOL!

results.description:
Whether you're completely new to meditation, fresh out of an MBSR class, or an advanced practitioner wanting to find a local sangha (supportive, like-minded individuals who help deepen your practice), this weekly meditation is open to all.

This week's group will be led by meditation teacher, Kerry Rasp and include guided sitting meditation in the Vipassana (Mindfulness) tradition and a short walking meditation. Our sit will be followed by question/answer and discussion. Chairs provided, though feel free to bring a yoga mat, blanket or cushions. No charge, but dana (a donation) will be gratefully accepted. (Suggested donation $10, but please give what is right for you.)

* Please try to arrive 5 min early, since we like to begin promptly at 7:30pm. And if you're late, please just enter quietly and join us.

* The Meetup RSVP list doesn't reflect actual attendance, since those from Insight Timer and other meditation groups also attend.
results.how_to_find_us: Park in the back parking lot at the rear of the church (entrance on Plymouth St).  Don't walk around to the front of the church. You'll see stairs at the back of the church. Head up those stairs & through the door, then go in the doorway on the left.

There are two 20 minute sitting meditation periods with one 10 min walking mediation period in between. You may only enter and exit the Zen Center during the walking meditation period. You may choose to sit for one period or for both periods. This is a time for quieting the mind and refocusing on who you are.

We look forward to sitting with you!


Palms together,

Taego Zen Center

For class #6, we will be in room 1203, this studio will be on building 500. We will begin at 8pm. Full address below.

Our Level 1 Salsa class on Thursdays is on it's 6th class and we have already learned the basic, the right turn, the left turn, partner holds, leading turns, and the cross-body-lead. We have also learned many dance concepts such as stepping with the balls of your feet and weight shifting. We are ready for class #6.

For those who missed last week, we will review so no worries.

Join our facebook group for music, videos, questions/answers, and general class info: https://www.facebook.com/groups/453057848231239/

Location: Pearl Studios, 500 Eighth Avenue (Btwn 35th & 36th)

Room: 1203 (12th floor)

Fee: $15 per class (cash only).

Time: 8pm- 9:30pm.

This week, we will learn a new footwork and review the a very important partner move called the cross-body-lead.

To use as reference for practice, here are the videos of some of the footwork we have learned so far. Practice them everyday even if for just 10 minutes. Practice is the difference between feeling lost and feeling confident.

results.description:
Like our Facebook Page!:

   facebook.com/ManhattanInternationalCoedSoccer

Game description: 

Teams are 4 V 4, no goalies, no gender requirements (but we'd like at least 1 female player per team). Games will be played on a 1st goal rotation basis or 15 minutes time limit. The team that scores first stays on  the field. But if your team remains on the field after scoring 3 goals, we'll split the team up so that everyone has a fair chance to have a great game.

RULES OF THE GAME:

First and most important rule of the game is to have fun and enjoy the time on the field! 

VERY IMPORTANT: 

- NO FOULS

- NO SIDE TACKLING

- NO PUSHING

- NO TELLING OFF

* ZERO TOLERANCE*


By minimizing physical contact, we minimize injuries and violence.


         “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”

If you don't sign up for the game, do not show up.

Rough play and offensive language will absolutely not be tolerated!!

We encourage competitive, but safe play. 

We reserve the right to ask anyone to leave who has exhibited any behavior that could be construed as violent, offensive, or dangerous. 

Those that don't comply with these rules, will kindly be asked to leave the field so others can enjoy the game. 


Any other questions regarding the rules of the game or anything else, should be directed to the organizer directly or to the assistant organizer/s!!!

Please check our meetup message board, 10 PM the night before to see what team you are on. This will save us a lot of time on the field.

Location and Directions:

West End Presbyterian Church

165 West 105th Street, New York, NY

Near the lines: 1, 2, 3, B, and C trains.

AS YOU COME IN, TAKE THE STAIRS ON YOUR LEFT AND WALK TO THE 4TH FLOOR.

Call me if you can’t find us - (917)[masked] Manny S.


What to bring with you: 
A positive attitude, pair of sneakers or INDOOR shoes (ONLY), shin guards (recommended) and lots of water.

Fee: 
You will be asked to pay $9.50 dollars when you RSVP. This $9.50 dollars is used to pay for: permits, meetup fees, Amazon fees, Goals, soccer balls etc.

Refund Policy: 


* The Meetup is cancelled

* You can cancel at least 2 day(s) before the Meetup


Very IMPORTANT Due to the location where we will be playing:

We expect everyone to respect the facilities and act accordingly.

Anyone who is asked to leave will not be refunded and WILL be permanently banned from the group

After the game we can go for a quick drink at:

                                            TAP a KEG

                                         2731 Broadway

                                     New York, NY 10025

                            Betwee[masked]th and Broadway  

By RSVP'ing you agree to our Liability waiver:

PARTICIPATING IN MANHATTAN-INTERNATIONAL-COED-SOCCER ACTIVITIES AGREEMENT: 


I certify that I have no known medical or other conditions that could interfere with my participation in Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer activities. Therefore, I, individually, hereby release and discharge, Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer Organizer and Assistant Organizers from any and all claims, actions, damages, losses, liabilities, costs and expenses of any kind whatsoever, including but not limited to any claims of negligence, arising out of, resulting from, by reason of, or in connection with my participation in any of Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer programs or activities. results.description:
Doc Bayne, formerly of Sterling Forest State Park, and now heading up The Friends of Sterling Forest (can be found atwww.friendsofsterlingforest.org), is returning to the Ramapo Mountain Ski Club on Thursday, 3/24/2016.  His previous talks at the club covered the history of Harriman and Sterling Forest State Parks, the iron mines throughout the area, and even the gardens at the now Tuxedo Ridge Ski Area / Renaissance Faire. 


He has spent the last several years researching the Great Chain Across the Hudson, instrumental in the success of the Revolutionary War.  He will be presenting his latest findings and anecdotes on this important part of our history. 

Want to: Meet your new ski/boarding buddy?  Learn about trips, lift ticket discounts, instruction, racing, hiking, and the amazing lodge in central Vermont?  Play free foosball, pool, shuffle board or darts?  Come to a meeting (maybe buy a drink at the bar at a good price) and introduce yourself to the person* closest to you and next thing you know you will be in the middle of 6 degrees of snow-mazing separation.  Thursdays from September to April, the snow networking location is at the Knights of Columbus (KofC) in Ramsey, 8 PM.

Park across the street in the train station parking lot. Many meetings have special speakers or activities, so keep an eye out for costume parties, equipment lectures, and amazing stuff.

FYI: Attendance varies (20-50 people usually) and represents only a small fraction of our 300+ membership base.  There will always be lots of dedicated skiers and boarders who are not on meetup.com who are in the official Ramapo Mountain Ski Club. Members vary in age (8-80 year olds come to meetings), ability, availability (schedule wise), and martial status (aka dating wise) - but everyone is looking for the perfect snow partner ;0)

Ramapo Mountain Ski Club Web Site

*For first timers: ask for Elyse, Ken of Hospitality, or Maggie, our President, to sign-in, help answer questions and connect you to others in the club with shared interests.

Ski yah Soon!

results.description:
Join us for our new open house potluck dinner night! It's for the Orgasmic Meditation community here in NYC and anyone (over 18) who wants to learn more about the OM practice and what we do! We will be playing one of our favorite games, Hot Seats! 

Hot Seats is a fun communication game where one person at a time can volunteer to have the attention the rest of the group placed on them for 1-2 minutes while they can be asked any question on any topic. You can chose to lie, tell the truth, or pass, but it's always encouraged to let your true self come out in a safe a fun environment.

Whether you are someone who already OMs, you are curious and want to meet some of the OM community, or you just want to enjoy a warm and electric evening of connection, come join us!!

Bring an item of food if you desire, and we will provide some extra food too! If you can't or don't have time, just bring $10 to drop in the jar. 

It's a casual atmosphere and one of our favorite ways to introduce friends to the concept of OM and the community itself since there will be lots of people there with years of experience in the practice. 

The event is free! The door will open at 7:45 and lock at 8:10 sharp, so please be on time!

For questions contact [masked] |[masked]  
Can't make this one?  visit us at www.turnonny.us
results.name: Open House! Community Potluck & Hot Seats

results.description:
This group meets on the 4th Thursday of each month to discuss various works of "modern" masters or upcoming talent in SF, fantasy, paranormal, horror and related genres. It also occasionally explores classics and the 'masters' of the classics.

Fortress Frontier by Myke Cole

The Great Reawakening did not come quietly. Across the country and in every nation, people began to develop terrifying powers, summoning storms, raising the dead, and setting everything they touch ablaze. Overnight the rules changed, .but not for everyone. Colonel Alan Bookbinder is an army bureaucrat whose worst war wound is a paper-cut. But after he develops magical powers, he is torn from everything he knows and thrown onto the front-lines. Drafted into the Supernatural Operations Corps in a new and dangerous world, Bookbinder finds himself in command of Forward Operating Base Frontier, cut off, surrounded by monsters, and on the brink of being overrun. Now, he must find the will to lead the people of FOB Frontier out of hell, even if the one hope of salvation lies in teaming up with the man whose own magical powers put the base in such grave danger in the first place, Oscar Britton, public enemy number one.
results.name: Modern Masters:  Fortress Frontier by Myke Cole

• ABSOLUTELY NO CLEATS ALLOWED! NO EXCEPTIONS!!

• BRING AN ALL WHITE SHIRT (Your teammates can see you better when you wear white under the fluorescent vests.)

• We play rain or shine!

(Leader- Chris W.)

(Co-leader- Art K.)

(We are looking for new Co-Leaders, are you interested? Talk to Chris W)

• PLEASE ARRIVE ON TIME - 8:00PM!! Game starts at 8:15pm sharp .

• NO BALL SMASHING! THIS IS A SPECIAL NIGHT BALL!

• Full rules explained at the game.

Code of Conduct:

Positivity - Constructive criticism after the game is way better than yelling and complaining during the game.

Safety - Want to kick someone really hard? go take jiujitsu. We like our shins.

2 = Teamwork. It takes 2 to complete every pass.

Generosity!!!! - Not just your money (though it helps). We want clapping and good cheers.

The proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

All RSVPs are final. No credits or refunds. (It's all for charity anyway)

If the game is cancelled, request a refund by filling out this form.

If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G raises money for charities that use soccer for social good restoring dignity where it's been lost through the game of soccer. We share the impact of this movement through multiple channels and promote generosity on the field through safe and supportive play.

PS2G - Local Game. Global Change. 

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.

(Leader- Chris W.)

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs (the roster shows 11 spots only because it includes the organizer who will play if needed). One game is 55-60 minutes. Please come a little early so that we all can start on time and play 1 solid hour. Goal keeper rotation every 5-6 minutes. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt (if you don't have red, a solid dark will do), indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence.

more info at [masked]

Thank you,

Jaime Arias

Since finding a suitable location for these Meetups has proven so difficult in the past I'm launching an experiment with a virtual reading group which will be conducted entirely online via Google Hangouts.  It will be a video call and I'll be using my PC, but anyone with a smartphone can participate.  We will go through the entire book in bi-weekly sessions covering roughly 50 pages for each session.   

For anyone who RSVP's yes, please send me your email so I can send an invite for the Google Hangout when it is set up.   I'll also email it out to people who RSVP'ed "yes" on Meetup right before it starts.

The itinerary is as follows:

March 10th: One-Dimensional Society, Sections 1 & 2 (Pages 1-56)

March 24th: One-Dimensional Society, Sections 3 & 4 (Pages[masked])

April 7th: One-Dimensional Thought, Sections 5 & 6 (Pages[masked])

April 21st: One-Dimensional Thought, Section 7 & The Chance of the Alternatives, Section 8 (Pages[masked])

May 5th: The Chance of the Alternatives, Sections 9 & 10 (Pages[masked]) and concluding discussion
results.name: Virtual Reading Group: Marcuse's One-Dimensional Man
