results.description:
Running is a good workout. Running up a hill is an awesome workout. Be awesome!


Every week is an adventure in hill work. Every week is different. Some workouts include... 

30 minute continuous run. Sprint up the 0.4 mile incline, touch the graffiti wall at the top, turn around and jog back to the bottom and then repeat.

http://vimeo.com/81450322

Timed interval sprints. 45 seconds as hard as you can up. 1 minute and 45 seconds recovery jog back to the start. You will be winded!

http://vimeo.com/81966561

Obstacle course training. Workout stations with short sprints between them. Sprint to the first, do a bunch of situps. Sprint to the next, do some lunges. Sprint a bit further and do some squats. Sprint to the top and do some pushups. Jog back to the start and repeat.

NOTE: there is NO secure place to store bags, valuables, etc. Please use caution and do not bring anything you cannot afford to lose. If you do leave your belongings at the bottom of the bridge (where we start running) be aware that there is a lot of foot traffic and it would not be surprising if something "walked away."
results.how_to_find_us: Meet at the bottom of the Manhattan side of the Williamsburg Bridge.
results.name: Hill Running Workout

Fun trip to beautiful Utah! Half road-trip, half hiking, its always a blast!  4 days / 3 nights.  This trip is limited to 7 participants.  Please apply directly online: https://travendly.com/tours/utah-group-travel/

Price:

$595

Dates: 

Friday, March 25, 2016 - Monday, March 28, 2016

Itinerary:

• Day 1: Begin by flying into Las Vegas around midday, drive East to Utah to Byway 12, and finally to Bryce Canyon.  Overnight near Bryce Canyon.  

• Day 2: First half of the day at Bryce Canyon then, after lunch, continue to Zion National Park.  Overnight in Springdale. 

• Day 3: Hike Zion!  Overnight in Springdale.  

• Day 4: Drive to LAS (Las Vegas Airport) for return flights 

What's included: 

• Hotels (double occupancy)

• All breakfasts (3 in total) 

• Private SUV (for entirety of trip incl. pick up & drop off at LAS)

• Bryce Canyon and Zion National Park entrance fees


Notes

• Flight is NOT included

results.description:
Hello Fam!

This week we have the pleasure of having Gesche Haas come and share her journey. (Special thanks to Natasha Fong for the intro)


Gesche Haas is the founder of Dreamers // Doers, a highly curated community of high-achieving trailblazing women who come together to support each other on their entrepreneurial paths. The community encompasses a diverse mix of female founders, women working at startups, and other female creators, change-makers, and influencers.

Gesche's views on the tech space, and beyond, have been featured onBloomberg TV, Business Insider, Forbes, Fortune Magazine, and other major media outlets. Gesche coined the term "Sharing Economy 2.0"which describes the capitalization of shared human capital (vs. fixed assets), trends in the freelance economy and remote workforce.

Prior to founding Dreamers // Doers, Gesche held senior positions at multiple venture-backed startups, in roles covering growth, strategy, finance, business operations, business development, and more. She also spent five years as an investor at a healthcare-focused hedge fund (~$3bn AUM, SAC spin-off).

Gesche is half German, half Chinese-Malaysian, and was born in Africa (Kingdom of Swaziland).

We'll get a chance to hear about her journey, with Q&A and community shout outs afterwards! Also join us for good coffee, good bagels, and excellent conversation.

Until then, stay cool and classy... See you then!

Future events:
** Office hours with Rubicon VC - Every Tuesday Morning **

4/1 - Shayne Veramallay (DLA Piper Venture Pipeline)
4/8 - Laurel Touby (Flatiron Investors)
4/15 - Yuni Sameshima (Chicory)
4/22 - Morgan Polotan (Bloomberg Beta)
4/29 - Paul Bianco (Director of FFVC Accelerator)
5/6 - Steven Greenberg (Unroll.me / FFVC)

results.description:
For coworking space, it's first come first served. You'll want to get there early to find a desk before it fills up. The space is available from 10am to 6pm. If you are planning on attending, you'll need to do the following things:

• Register at the AWS Pop-up Loft Space - https://aws.amazon.com/start-ups/loft/ny-loft/

• Once you are registered you can pick up a badge and attend any of the co-working meetups.

• Let us know you are going by signing up for the event on meetup. This also lets other people in the group know who is going to be there too.

• Remember to check the Pop-up Loft website to make sure it is open. We'll do out best to cancel meetups on holidays and days the space won't be available but you should also double check before coming out.

• While there are snacks and drinks at the space, lunch is not provided. There are a number of restaurants, delis and other places to get food in the area so plan accordingly

• These daily coworking events are self run. A co-organizer will not always be at the event. These events are designed to give game developers a free space to work so you'll basically be left alone at the space to do you own thing. We suggest reaching out to other attending through the comments to sit together or meet up at a specific time in the space.

Last thing, two times a month we'll have a dedicated space for you to come out and work as well as listen to talks and get help from myself and others in the community. Those will be different events you'll need to register for which are separate from the daily co-working space.
results.name: Indie Coworking Space

results.description:

results.description:
Alright, I just found out I have the day off,  and it doesn't look like it's supposed to rain until later in the day now.  Woo hoo! This hike is about 4 miles, and we should be done with it in a couple hours.  Afterwards, we'll grab a bite to eat somewhere.  It's the first parking lot off of 287 after you get off the exit onto Skyline Drive, so keep your eyes open for it.  I'll give those of you who sign up my cell number just in case. Driving Directions

Take Interstate Route 287 to Exit 57 (Skyline Drive/Ringwood) and proceed north on Skyline Drive (following the signs to "Ringwood"). Just ahead on the left is the Ramapo Mountain State Forest parking area.

Description

From the southern end of the parking area, follow the blue blazes of the MacEvoy Trail, which passes stone ruins, turns right onto a woods road and climbs a steep pitch. The trail continues to climb on a wide, rocky path, paralleling a cascading brook (particularly attractive after heavy rains). About half a mile from the start, the white-blazed Todd Trail begins to the right, but you should continue ahead on the blue-blazed trail, which crosses a tributary stream.

Near the crest of the rise, the yellow-blazed Hoeferlin Trail joins from the right. Continue ahead, now following both blue and yellow blazes. After a short descent, the trail reaches a paved estate road. Turn left and follow the road downhill to the dam. Here, the blue blazes turn right, but you should continue ahead across the dam of Ramapo Lake, following the yellow blazes.

On the other side of the dam, the red-blazed Lookout Trail begins on the left, and in about 500 feet, the yellow-blazed Hoeferlin Trail leaves to the left. Continue ahead along the wide gravel road, now unmarked, which runs close to the lakeshore, with views across the lake. To the north, atop a hill with several pines, you can see the ruins of Foxcroft, a mansion built in 1910 which fell into disrepair in the 1950s.

The road proceeds through dense laurel thickets, crosses a causeway over an arm of the lake, and passes a swamp to the left and several interesting rock outcrops. It then moves away from the lakeshore but continues to parallel it, with views over the lake through the trees.

Just past the southern end of the lake, about a mile from the dam, the road reaches a T intersection, where you should turn right. Then, in another 300 feet, bear right at a Y intersection. Here, the Cannonball Trail, marked by white-“C”-on-red blazes, joins from the left. You’re now heading north through dense laurel thickets, paralleling the western shore of Ramapo Lake. At first, the road runs some distance from the water, but after a while, the lake can be seen through the trees. In half a mile, you’ll pass a building on the hillside to the left (formerly used as a ranger station) and, a short distance beyond, a rock ledge to the right of the trail offers a pleasant view of the lake.

Soon, another gravel road joins from the left. Follow the road ahead, crossing a stone causeway that isolates a quiet pond on the left from the main body of the lake. Next, you’ll reach another Y intersection. Here, the Cannonball Trail turns left onto an intersecting gravel road, but you should bear right and continue along a winding section of the lakeshore road, now once again unmarked. A short distance ahead, bear left as another road leads right. After passing a small, abandoned stone building to the right, you’ll come to another intersection. Here, you should bear right, joining the blue-blazed MacEvoy Trail.

Follow the blue-blazed gravel road that runs close to the shore along the northern end of the lake, passing a private residence on a ledge to the left. When you return to the northern end of the dam, bear left, uphill, on the road, then follow the blue blazes as they turn right, reentering the woods. Continue along the blue-blazed trail, retracing your steps back to the parking area where the hike began.

Course:  Fun Fingers

Adult Learning:  Does it drive you crazy that your child keeps selects the same tray of work every class?  Do (s)he ask you to read the same book over and over and over again?  Let's talk about it!

results.description:
How does a TennisNewYork Season / League run?

The league advertises the season dates and builds a queue of committed players for the season.

Kickoff Day - March 25th

The start day of the season, players are sent a kickoff email that contains important information about the league, the link where your league standings and players contact information. We guarantee 6 playing partners at your playing level, but have been averaging closer to 15+ partners in most cities.

Your Task - "Flexible Scheduling"

After this kickoff email is sent, it is the player's task to communicate with other players. Players should work with their partners to find an agreeable time and location to play the match. While TennisNewYork doesn't mandate your playing schedule, it is recommended that players schedule at least one match per week. By request of the players, we started to allow players to play 1 rematch per season. The regular season is all about playing as much as you can. As of Jan. 1st, 2013 we've had 189 players play more than 20 matches in a season.


Special Note for NYC tennis players: We don't have any special privileges to use the courts throughout New York City. You do need to follow by the rules provided by the Parks Department. How to reserve tennis courts in NYC: NYC Park & Rec.

Where to Play?

Play at your local free tennis courts, tennis parks, condo courts or tennis clubs. The league strongly suggests that players jointly try to pick a tennis court location convenient to both. We provide an extensive list of tennis courts, including # of courts, lighting, hitting walls, etc. We strive to keep this list up-to-date.

How to Play?

Players can use three semi-standard playing formats: 2 out of 3 sets, 2 sets with 10 point super tie-breaker or the 10-game pro set (First to 10, used when court time is limited).

Playoffs

Each season concludes with a playoffs where players with anywhere from 3 to 5 season wins qualifies for a single elimination tourney. The champion is awarded based upon the league Prize Pool. Each singles league champion also receives a playing entry into the National Tourney which is already scheduled for Crandon Park Tennis Center in Key Biscayne - Nov. 13-15, 2015.

Join Today!!

Full price is $29.95 to play in a season, BUT the earlier you sign up we typically offer discounts during these tougher economic times. Just go to the Join Page and complete the short form. We'd be happy to find you dedicated tennis playing partners.

results.description:
Mt. Beacon Fire ~Tower Hike ~

 A steady pace all the way to the fire tower. 


Not good for a first time hiker .


4 miles 

Hiking Poles are helpful

bring a drink and a snack



Trail info- We will be taking the steps from the Gateway park to the Red trail. The trail is 6 or 7 switchbacks up to the old casino with a very rewarding look out point where you can see sweeping views of the Hudson river and surrounding area.


Distance: 4 miles round trip

The First 0.8 miles of this hike is hard, and very steep with 1000ft. elevation gain.
Mount Beacon is the second highest point in the Hudson Highlands. Depending on the map, it may be called Mount Beacon or Beacon Mountain. The mountain consists of two peaks. The northern peak is 1531ft and has a series of radio antennas on its summit. The higher southern peak is 1610ft and has a lookout tower on its summit.
On a clear morning we will see the NYC skyline lights from the summit as well as views of the town of Beacon and the majority of the Highlands (including Storm King, Breakneck Ridge, and little Sugarloaf).

+++

results.description:
I am a Spanish native speaker and suggest we meet at pret a manger to help you to improve your Spanish!

There is a maximum of 6 students per group and costs $10/person if the class is more than 3 people and $15/person if the class is 1 to 3 people.

My phone number is[masked] just in case you cannot find me.

Don´t sign up if you are not sure you can come.

The lesson lasts 1 hour.

Hasta pronto!

Beguinner level means: you are not able to speak without the help of the teacher, you just know really little common expresions. We will go thought the basics.

Intermediate level means: you can explain yourself with the help of the teacher, you can build up sentences but they are basic or you make mistakes on them. You have lacks of vocabulary and grammar.

Advanced level means: you are fluent in Spanish, you can explain yourself without a lof of problems. You know the vocabulary. Advanced students normally make gramatical mistakes when they talk and can forget some words, that is perfectly normal.
results.name: Spanish conversation advanced. $10/person if more 3people or $15/p if less

results.description:
PLEASE RSVP ON DHARMA DRINK MEETUP PAGE (www.dharmadrink.com - thank you!)

 

A great way to get Dharma connected in New York!

Meeting monthly at the Rubin during the summer - but special events will be announced like "Dharma Drink at the Beach or the Park" plus special group visits to see amazing teachers as the come to NYC over the summer!  Should be awesome!!!

 

For people interested in Buddhism or meditation or just leading a kinder life who are up for meeting like minded people.

Dharma Drink is now Self Service!

The table is always reserved in the same spot - just show up and see what happens  - just like if you were hanging out meeting other Buddhists randomly in Kathamandu or India. And don't take the RSVP too seriously - people are coming now who don't RSVP. The word is getting out....

Everyone is invited! Dharma Drink is all about building community amongst the Buddhist and like minded crowd in New York City. I was inspired to start Dharma Drink by hanging out with all of the great students of all of the different lamas in Kathmandu - Kagyu, Nyingma, Sakya, Gelug - totally Rimey (also Zen, Thai, Theravadan, yoga travelers, just about everyone!).  We all became great friends and learned from each other. We're there every Friday night - see you there.


Motivation:  To make the Rubin Museum Lounge on Friday night the Buddhist  hang-out spot in New York.

Who:  ALL ARE INVITED.  Feel free to spread the word.  The more, the merrier.

Time:  6-?pm
Date:  Every Friday - like clockwork
Place:  Rubin Museum Lounge, 17th Street and 7th Avenue
How to find us:  Look for a table with the small sign "Dharma Drink"                          + Lounge staff  will know where we are.

 

www.dharmadrink.com
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be at a high-top table with little sign that says Dharma Drink opposite the Ganesh statue - the lounge staff will know where we are in case you get totally lost.
results.name: Dharma Drink: the hangout for Buddhists and like minded people

results.description:
If you're interested in getting on a stage in a low pressure environment to try some improv, this event is for you! I have reserved space at the basement stage of the Triple Crown Ale House. We will likely to do some warmups, 2-person scenes, and then do some short sets with other more veteran improvisers. Participate as much or as little as you would like. Or simply come and watch! 

All who attend will get to do 2-person scenes and a bigger jam set at the end!  This is the most low pressure fun performance opportunity out there - perfect for all!  If you're think you're ready, you're ready!  All scenes will be inspired by a suggestion of a random word from the audience.  


I've also invited improvisers from the NYC improv community to attend as well.  So you may get to play with some veteran improvisers as well.
results.how_to_find_us: Go downstairs to the basement at 6pm (go to the back of the bar and go down the stairs)

results.description:
Let's take a short hike to refresh the soul. 

We will be hiking down in the dark....come prepared please.

_____________


We will meet just NORTH of the Bear Mountain Bridge.

Distance: about 2-3 miles

Hike time: 1.5 - 2 hours

This hike offers outstanding views up and down the Hudson River and the Bear Mountain Bridge.

Please dont be late - we start on time


Getting There

From NYC take the palisades interstate parkway north for approximately 40 miles until its end at the Bear Mountain Bridge. Take a left at the end of the bridge. Approximately 0.1 miles down the road on the Southbound side is a paved shoulder where we will park. There is a small AT blaze on one of the trees that identifies the trail head.

From I-84, take exit 11 to 9D south. Follow 9D through Beacon and Cold Spring until you reach the Bear Mountain Bridge. Parking is available on small turnoffs on 9D .1 miles before you reach the bridge.

NOTE: You are responsible for bringing appropriate gear, supplies, clothing, first aid, and lights. You should review topographic maps and trail features carefully; understanding topography of any hike is key to your knowing where you are, where you're going, and how to get back. See suggestions for GEAR on the "About" page for additional gear ideas.

You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below.

If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.

Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver. Full waiver can be found on the ABOUT page.
results.name: Last Minute! Anthonys Nose, a hike for the soul!

results.description:
Hyatt Place is a new hotel in downtown Flushing, located just a block away from the Main St. stop of the 7 train.  It is also accessible via every bus line that goes though Flushing (Q20, Q44, Q25, Q34, Q27, Q17, Q65, Q48, Q13, Q28, Q16, Q58, Q12, Q66, Q19, Q50, Q15, Q26).

We mostly play newer "euro" style board games (Ticket to Ride and Settlers of Catan are among the oldest) that often run 1.5 to 3.0 hours. If you arrive while games are going on, prepare to hang out and chat while they finish up then organize for a new game.

We are permitted to bring food into the lobby, but EVERYONE MUST BUY AT LEAST 1 THING FROM THE BAR, AND TIP THE BARTENDER VERY WELL. The venue we are using is a business and we want them to be glad to have us there.


Please keep noise level down to a minimum to avoid distracting the hotel guests and clean up after yourselves (the trash area is just a few feet away).

The card keys for the bathrooms are available from the front desk.  As a courtesy, please check to see if anyone else in the group needs to use the keys before returning them to the front desk.
results.name: Friday evening gaming at Flushing

results.description:
Hi everyone, 

Thank you for the awesome turnout at our February meetup! Due to the overwhelming positive feedback, we will return to Vapiano in March to repeat the experience. 

Vapiano is close to Union Square for easy transportation, has individual payment system to avoid shared checks, a large space to accommodate large group and a very low music level for conversations. Plus, they have plenty of food should you come hungry.

NOTE: You will receive a plastic card upon entering, which you use to place all your orders at the bar or counter. At the end of the night you pay off your card as you exit the place.

Is there a Cover Charge?

No! Our monthly meetup is free of charge as always.

If you like to help offset the cost for maintaining our group, you can make a $1 donation to our piggy bank, it is well appreciated but there is absolutely no obligation to do so.

Do I have to speak German?

No. While many are German natives who will speak German, our conversations are usually mixed depending on your skills and preferences.

How long is the event?

Vapiano closes at Midnight. Last time many of our members stayed until closing, some went out clubbing afterwards, but there is no official end time. If you like to stay, you stay. If you need to head out early or just wanna stop by and say hi, that is totally fine. On the flipside, of course, there is no guarantee that we will stay till closing. Depends on how the night is going :)

How do I get there by train?

4/5/6/N/R/Q/L -  Union Square: 1-3 blocks

F/M - 14th St: 3 blocks

A/C/E/B/D - West 4th St: 10 blocks or tranfser to F/M to 14th St

Please look at your RSVP and change it if your plans have changed so we can keep the venue updated on our expected attendance.

I am looking forward to see plenty of you guys!!

Thomas

[masked]

[masked]

results.description:
Let's get together and trade some Disney pins!! Some people come with just a lanyard full of pins other come with a stack of books full of pins.  Either way we welcome you to our group.  We are happy to answer any questions that you may have about pins and will try to guide all of the new traders in a direction of years of fun and trading.  We will meet from 6-9PM in the food court just outside of the elevators.  We hope to see you there.

 

We ask that you not bring food since we are in the mall food court.  Please plan on buying something such as a drink at the very least so that we are actually adding to the mall's profits.  We are using their space after all for free.

 

I appreciate your RSVP so I know who to look for or not.

 

You can email me at [masked] anytime for a faster response.

My wife and I don't always get to the pin meet due to our kids social lives.   Other people do go, but if you are coming for the first time I want to make sure that we are there to greet you and make you feel comfortable.

 

Please feel free to email me with any questions that you may have.

 

Thanks,

Steven

results.description:
Metta, or Lovingkindness Meditation (LKM), is the practice of wishing oneself and others happiness, health, and ease. Studies indicate that practicing LKM positively impacts our emotions, our physical health, and our sense of connection. Our weekly Metta Meditation Group meets for practice and discussion every week with IDP's Executive Director, Kimberly Brown. 

This offering is open to both beginners and experienced meditators. Cushions and chairs will be provided. We request a $10-$20 donation to support our organization, though no one will be turned away for lack of funds.

Note we are located on the 2nd floor of a walk-up building. There is no elevator.


The Interdependence Project
302 Bowery 3rd Floor, Middle Buzzer
Between Houston and 1st Street
results.name: Lovingkindness Meditation Group

活动收取门票$5每人。到场并参与游戏的请准备$5现金，刷卡$6。请在入场时交付并登记姓名 （定期有特殊优惠)。只观战不参与游戏的，不需要交费。晚到或提前退场但参与游戏的，门票价钱一样$5。

---------------------------------------------------------

如果你玩过杀人游戏或狼人杀，却还没听过阿瓦隆，那我不得不说您有点out啦！

与狼人杀相似，阿瓦隆也是一款角色扮演加逻辑推理游戏，玩家扮演不同身份，在辩驳之中分辨好人坏人。与狼人杀不同的是，玩家人数为5 - 10人，每一位玩家都能够参与到游戏最后，不存在被杀被票死就只能干看别人玩的情景。

这个游戏考验玩家的逻辑分析能力以及彼此的信任度，是一款绝对不会让你失望的游戏！如果您没有玩过这款游戏也不用担心，游戏规则很简单5分钟就可以学会，即便您对此游戏一无所知来参加我们活动也没关系。

玩家人数达到5人即举办活动，游戏时间3月25日6:30pm - 9:30pm。如果人数多，会开两桌或组织升级等其他游戏。地点在距离Penn Station步行五分钟的XYZ IMPRESSION Studio。地址：470 7th Ave, Suite 410, New York, NY 10018. 由于游戏受玩家人数影响，请大家尽量早到5 - 10分钟，不要迟到，6:30pm准时开始介绍游戏规则。

This free workshop introduces the The Art of Living Foundation's seminal programs.  Over 40 million people worldwide have benefited from the Foundation's programs which teach simple yet powerful breathing and meditative techniques for reducing stress, anxiety, and fear, while increasing the potential for clarity, joy, and inner peace.

In the workshop we explore the connection between breath and meditation and state of mind.  Participants will experience the breath as a fundamental tool to unlocking a happier, more relaxed state of being with higher levels of awareness, focus and clarity.  We will experience the yoga of breath and end with a guided meditation.

Participants will also learn more about the additional course offerings at Art of Living Foundation which will allow them to develop a personal home practice. 

When:Friday 6:30pm-7:45pm

**Please arrive early for seating and registration

Where: 286 5th Ave  5th Floor (between 30th and 31st St) NY 10001

Please take your RSVP seriously as other guests often have to be turned away. 

With almost 5 stars of total 113 Review at Yelp, we must try this place:

49-11 Roosevelt Ave
Woodside, NY 11377
Neighborhood: Woodside

(718)[masked]

According to one Yelper:

Sik Gaek's seafood was very legit and the place was no gimmicky at all. It's the live octopus and live lobster place in Woodside, Queens with a sister resto in Flushing.


It contained two live octopii (moving), live lobster (moving), live abalone, sea snail, razor clams, crab, mussels, shrimp, baby octopus, ..., in a broth (similar to soondooboo) with udon.

 Picture of our previous events

2013


2011 event


2012

2013

Out of all the sea specimens, the live lobster was the most tasty. The sea snail was great too.


With the octopus, you have the option of having one (or both) served on the side, so you can eat it raw while moving. Even 20 mins after it was cut up, its pieces would move when poked.

If you go, order the watermelon soju too. It comes in a large watermelon, and tastes very good.

I highly recommend this place to seafood lovers. The food was fresh and delicious. It's a must for adventurous foodies! Yes, I'm talking to you, Yelpers.

Sik Gaek
49-11 Roosevelt Ave (& 49th St)
Woodside, Queens

*We will meet to create together and learn from each other! Heidi will share techniques as we go along but this event is more for the social aspect of making art together. There are no "set" projects or techniques-work on what you want to. Heidi will be creating art, too! 

*You will have access to Heidi's stencils, paints, sprays, etc. ($10 fee) The $10 fee also covers wine, drinks and snacks. Please feel free to bring goodies to share with the group. 

Please bring these supplies each week: 

*art journal

*adhesive-Matte Medium/gluesticks

*gesso

*something for color-acrylic paints, watercolor crayons, collage papers, watercolors, spray inks

*permanent pens/markers

*paintbrushes

*pencils for drawing

*stencils 

Check out Heidi's ART on her blog at: Gotham City Stampers

Hello Artists! Do you have those packs of paper with tons of sheets that you will never use up? How about great napkins with 100 in the pack? Tons of collage that you can't possibly use up? 
I thought it would be fun to bring along things that you want to share with the others at our ART JOURNALING CLUB EVENTS. (You certainly don't have to!) New art journalers are trying to build up their stash of goodies. Those of us that have been doing it for a bit love getting our hands on new things! You could also bring those supplies that you don't use-see if they can find a new home with someone from our group. 
I recently picked up two awesome packs of napkins that I love to use as background layers on my pages. I can't possibly use them all so everyone will be getting some. 
Again, no pressure to bring something but I wanted to put it out there as something fun to add to our already great time together!

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, timed it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds will be honored only with a minimum of 24 hour cancelation.  No refunds for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

The school entrance is located on East 109th street between 2nd and 3rd avenues (near 2nd avenue) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right) and someone will open the door for you.

For questions,  use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
InspiredWordNYC presents LAST FRIDAYZ @ Local Project, an open mic event inspired by the epochal underground spirit of the long-gone Gaslight Café, SAMO, and Folk City.

A dynamic mix of music, poetry, spoken word, comedy, and performance art – with electrifying showcased artists – LAST FRIDAYZ will happen the last Friday of the month in March, April, May, June, September, and October within one of NYC's great creative spaces, Local Project – a non-profit arts organization that for over a decade in Long Island City, Queens, has been committed to providing emerging artists with a space and educational forum.

ALL AGES WELCOME.

Social media hashtag: #LICLastFridayz

Doors open @ 7pm, ends at midnight.

Tickets are discounted online or $10 each person at the door.

$7 Early Bird Specials are available up to a week prior to the date. *Limited Availability*

Make sure to bring a printed out version of your ticket/tickets or be prepared to show your ticket/tickets (with confirmation number) on your phone.

Please Note: No TRANSFERS or REFUNDS will be granted, though you are welcome to find REPLACEMENTS for your tickets.

InspiredWordNYC will donate $1 of every ticket sold to Local Project. There’s also a donation option on this page where you can donate whatever you'd like directly to this wonderful organization.

*****
Who: Produced by InspiredWordNYC
http://InspiredWordNYC.com

What: LAST FRIDAYZ Open Mic

When: Last Friday of the month (March, April, May, June, September, October, 7pm

Where: Local Project

http://www.localproject.org/

[masked]th Road (between 21st and 11th Street)Long Island City QueensTake E,M,G or 7 train to Court Square.

Why: Because we NEED great cultural events in Queens!

*****

Hosted by Megan DiBello - https://www.poetryteachersnyc.com/faculty/megan-dibello/

*****

Local Project is committed to building an educational forum for emerging artists of exceptional vision, and creating synergy between the exhibition of their work and the public. We believe diversity is essential to growth. Founded in 2003 by a group of Latin American artists and friends, LP is committed to offering year-round exhibitions, arts mentoring, and bilingual (Spanish/English) programming, while building bridges between Latino culture and other global communities. At LP, we support all forms of self-expression by providing an open space for artists of all genres, media, or provenances. LP provides a creative harbor for all, where artist and community can collaborate towards a richer and fuller development of both.

All levels are welcomed.

Our sessions are 2.5 hours with a long break in the middle. Attendees will draw from still lives with a break every half hour. 

During our session I will break off with each attendee individually to talk about the work they are creating and their individual drawing challenges. 

This is the fastest way to improve your drawing skills. It is a combination of practice and theory in the same class. 

Since each attendee comes to the session at a different level and with different challenges it is my goal to work with each person individually. 

• Space is limited and the setting is ideal. 

• Refreshments are served at the long break in the middle of the session. 

• Please bring a pad up to 16x20, a 2H, HB and 4B pencil and an eraser. 

• The price is $25 paid at the time of the class. 

• All levels are welcomed.

• Please RSVP through this meetup so I know you are coming. 

I look forward to seeing you there!

Simon

Simon Levenson is the drawing instructor at The National Arts Club and teaches drawing at The Morgan Library & Museum and The Museum of The City of New York.  Please read reviews by other students of his teaching here.

About Irma Caceres “StarSpirit Woman”

Irma StarSpirit Woman is a Medicine Woman honoring the ways of the curanderas (medicine healers) & her Mayan Ancestors, her medicine elders, She is a shamanic and Reiki practioner, Certified Crystal Healer, Dreamworker, an Ordained Minister in the Order of Melchizedek, Co-Founder of the New York Shamanic Healing Circle, and core member of the NY Shamanic Circle for 18 years.

StarSpirit Woman uses sound healing, fire readings, crystals, and works with the “poderios”, the elemental forces we need to keep an open channel of communication. Her style is accompanied by prayer work and traditional indigenous ceremonies to heal her community with heart. results.description: The Body Workshop is really about the exploration of self acceptance and the opportunity to pause and ask "what exactly is my relationship with my body?" Images of how we think we need to look can fatigue us. They unground us. Ideal body images have the effect of distancing ourselves from the exact bodies we are trying so hard to morph, change and perfect. Images force us to reject our own body as a source of shelter, strength and pleasure and instead we often use it as a means to an end. We've got to get off this horrible ride. We've got to come back home to our bodies. Our workshops are dynamic by design. They take us through a process of thinking, feeling, doing, being and engaging. We use creative expression, movement, sound, stillness and contact as a way of exploring our bodies. It's a totally awesome and unique adventure. We hope you will join us!
results.name: Core Energetics Workshop on Body Image -Free

results.description:
Get ready to get happier simply by talking about happiness! It's great if you can RSVP in advance, but in case you can't, come anyway.

As a reminder, this group has two goals. The first is to explore the relationship between happiness and goodness. The second, much more fun, goal is for us to become much happier just by getting together and talking about happiness. The theory behind this second goal comes from a classic psychology study showing that by simply talking regularly about happiness we can become much happier.

While we'll depart from them whenever and however much we may wish, like by talking about gratitude, acts of kindness, meditation and other happiness techniques, the following list of 14 topics will serve as a backdrop for our discussions.

1. Keep busy and be more active
2. Spend more time socializing
3. Be productive at meaningful work
4. Get better organized and plan things out
5. Stop worrying
6. Lower your expectations and aspirations
7. Develop positive, optimistic thinking
8. Become present oriented
9. Develop an outgoing, social personality
10. Work on a healthy personality
11. Be yourself
12. Eliminate negative feelings and problems
13. Close relationships are the number one source of happiness
14. Put happiness as your most important priority.

Here's some background on the research our group is based on.

In 1980 three New Zealand researchers found that after eight 2-hour conversation sessions about happiness over four weeks, their subjects reported a 22 percent increase in their happiness. Continuing their twice-weekly sessions, by the sixteenth week they reported being 42 percent happier.

Our list of topics comes from Fort Myers, Florida psychologist Michael Fordyce's "14 Fundamentals of Happiness." In 1977, Fordyce pioneered the science of happiness-increase with the world's first experiment designed to boost individual happiness.

That's the group, and those are our goals. It's also very, very important that we have fun. With that in mind, let's get ready to get good and happy!


Resources:

For those interested in learning about the major findings from social science research about happiness, and becoming happier, here are links to several excellent peer-reviewed articles that can be downloaded as pdf files for free. (Note: Although these classic articles are somewhat dated, decades of research on happiness reveal that findings on happiness tend to be extremely stable over time.)

Pursuing Happiness: The Architecture of Sustainable Change 
By S Lyubomirsky, KM Sheldon and D Schkade, 2005.  21 pages

In Pursuit of Happiness: Empirical Answers to Philosophical Questions 
By P Kesebir and E Diener, 2008. 9 pages.

Subjective Well-Being: Three Decades of Progress 
By E Diener, EM Suh, RE Lucas and HL Smith, 1999. 27 pages

results.description:
Hey Fellow Brainiacs,
If there ever was a Nerd Nite for you to attend, this is probably it (please note you should buy tickets in advance).  Nerd Nite NYC is turning 10!  Yes, we somehow managed to stick around since our debut in March 2006, so join us on Friday March 25, 2016 at Le Poisson Rouge for our 10-year anniversary extravaganza.  In addition to me waxing nostalgic and giving copious shout-outs to the many people who helped Nerd Nite along the way, this Nite will feature some audience participation and, most importantly, five of my favorite presentations of the last 10 years that will perfectly showcase the fun-yet-informative and formal-yet-informal spirit of Nerd Nite. Oh, and wear a nerdy t-shirt too. This is a big one!  Buy tickets here.

Nerd Nite NYC
Friday March 25, 2016
Le Poisson Rouge
158 Bleecker Street (Greenwich Village)
Presentations at 7pm (Doors at 6pm): $15 buy tickets here

Back to the Lectures At-Hand:
*Presentation #1
TETROMINOWLEDGE: How Four Blocks, Arranged In Different Patterns, Have Changed the World, Kind Of
by Neil Janowitz

Description: In 20 minutes, you will be taken through 20 years of Tetris development, including, but not limited to, the creation and ensuing lawsuits, the evolution, the competition and the strategy.

Bio: Neil Janowitz is a professional Tetris scholar who tours the country giving conferences and motivational speeches. He has collected his work into a book (now legendary in the field), Seven Little Pieces. His personal high score is 406,922 (NES, Nintendo release), which he thought was good until a friend, who is clearly much, much more intelligent, casually sat down and beat that score by almost 40,000. That hurt him.

*Presentation #2
Human Parasites (No, Not your Mooching Roommate)
by Dr. John Dodson

Description: Since the dawn of humans, there have been human parasites. Enjoy and squirm your way through an overview of several of these creatures that have tormented humanity over millennia, ranging from giant intestinal worms to microscopic brain-eating amoebas.  Yum.

Bio: John Dodson, MD is a cardiologist at NYU School of Medicine and has no interaction with human parasites in his day to day practice. However, he always found parasitology one of the most fascinating parts of medical school.

*Presentation #3
Hot or Not? How to be a Perfect 10 or How to Manipulate People’s Perceptions of Physical Attractiveness
by Lillian Park

Description: Beauty may only be “skin deep,” but several advantages are afforded to those who are perceived as being physically attractive. Perceptions of beauty and physical attractiveness are influenced by several factors, including but not limited to environmental, economic, cultural, and ecological. If you think dating in New York is like being in the Hunger Games and would like to have the odds be ever in your favor, Lillian Park will be discussing empirically-supported methods of how you manipulate people into thinking that you are even more attractive (without having to resort to plastic surgery!).

Bio: Lillian Park is an Associate Professor of Psychology at SUNY College at Old Westbury. She is still trying to teach undergraduates that research methods and statistics are more fun than Freudian psychoanalysis.

*Presentation #4
Incredible and Undiagnosed: One Pathologist’s Unexpected Findings
by Jay Stahl Herz

Description: While the purpose of an autopsy is to determine the cause of death, sometimes a pathologist may uncover an incidental unrelated medical curiosity. This talk will highlight completely unexpected and undiagnosed findings that may seem too weird to believe.

Bio: Jay Stahl-Herz, MD is a board-certified forensic pathologist working full-time as a medical examiner and forensic consultant. He holds academic appointments at New York University School of Medicine and SUNY Downstate College of Medicine. He has several published journal articles and book chapters and has presented at various national meetings and training courses. He is a fellow of the National Association of Medical Examiners, has consulted for the United Nations and worked in many other nations.

*Presentation #5
Godzilla: History, Biology and Behavior of Hyper-Evolved Theropod Kaiju
by Shyaporn Theerakulstit

Description: Tsunami, earthquake, hurricane and typhoon all rolled in one, Godzilla, “King of the Monsters,” has both plagued and benefited humanity for over half a century. By examining the origins and zoology of this force of nature, people and nations will be better equipped to deal with the awesome destructive power of our radioactive visitor from the Cretaceous.

Bio: Shyaporn Theerakulstit is an actor, writer, director and D-List YouTuber, where he posts videos about drug addicted Easter bunnies, unemployed Superfriends and flying kittens. You can see examples of his internet hackery at youtube.com/shyaporn.

Dry T-Shirt Contest
I like doing these. So wear a nerdy t-shirt and maybe you’ll win a prize.

Thanks!

Matt

For six years we have managed awesome MeetUp events for NYC creative professionals. We started small, but over time have grown to nine groups and over 11,500 members. In order to enhance and expand our collective, we are moving to a more flexible platform. 

We regularly host monthly networking and socializing events for our members to broaden their community and engage in active team building. We address career opportunities, industry trends and financial issues via educational workshops, panels and webinars.

results.description:
Super Confidence In 5 Minutes

How do people that get things done always seem to motivate themselves or find the energy? Do you walk towards amazing rewards? When you get knocked off balance do you how to get back in balance? The next step BEYOND yoga and meditation for mind body communications. The programs will only cover new stuff you have not seen and heard in other places. You can only achieve results in life when your brain is tuned to work at your personal best.


You think you can do it? You wish you could do it. You want to do it. You have done it at times in your life when everything just seems to flow like magic. Some people appear to always walk into the best and lucky situations. There is a STEP-BY-STEP Cognitive Mechanical method to 

ATTRACT YOUR FULL POTENTIAL BEFORE:

YOU GO ON A DATE 
YOU WALK INTO A MEETING 
YOU START WRITING YOUR BOOK 
YOU PITCHING TO INVESTORS 
START THE SALE MEETING 
AND MUCH MORE

CLICK HERE TO GET TO CONFIDENCE FASTER


How amazing would you feel if EVERYTHING you did got BETTER and you had more energy at the end of your day-everyday? Surprise yourself by making EVERYTHING in your life 10% BETTER. If you could make everything you do 10% BETTER, how would your life change? EXPERIENCE A NEW APPROACH TO TUNING YOUR BRAIN-mind SYSTEM DIRECTLY.


How Many Hats Do You Have To Wear moment-to-moment?

Stop and think about your work,business, relationships,dating, finance, and everyday moments. 
How many hats do life require you wear and how many hats do you volunteer to wear? 
Maybe hats of: mother/father,girlfriend/boyfriend, entrepreneur, small business owner, executive, best friend, lover, and more. 
Hour-to-hour your day changes so rapidly that you have to change hats often and sometimes wear two or more hats at the same time.

Now, is the time to become 10% GREAT at EVERYTHING you do.


$15.00 online 
$20.00 at the door

Location 
Superconfident In 5 Minutes 
FRIDAY March 25

Time 7:00 pm To 9:00 pm 
Location: Ripley-Grier 
520 8th Avenue 17 FL 
Between 36th and 37th street 
New York, NY 10018 
Please be on time, allow for traffic and delays in your travel plans.

Take the Right Hand side elevator to the 17 Floor 
Walk though the glass doors and turn left and at the end 
turn right then left to the end of the hall


NOTE: If there is a ROOM CHANGE consult the front desk.


Room: 17 M


WHO SHOULD ATTEND And BENEFIT? 
Entrepreneurs, Running a Start up, Artists, Writers,Self-employed, educators, managers & executives, or Salespersons. Anyone and everyone with beliefs and those who communicate with others that have beliefs. Someone that wants more FREEDOM, CREATIVITY AND ACHIEVEMENT in their lives.

CURATOR

The Cognitive Artist & Stylist James Murdock operates a boutique-consulting and coaching practice. The primary focus of the practice is providing training in Human performance engineering and organizational development. He is a cultural trends tracker, communication skills and persuasion expert. Mr. Murdock is an independent researcher in the areas of cognitive Science, Human Behavior Engineering and accelerated Human change. His work has been featured both nationally and internationally in media ranging from Marie Claire magazine, ABC news, NBC news, The Gayle King Show, Spotlight magazine, Providence journal, New York press, The British Star, Manhattan Spirit, and New York Non-Stop, plus numerous National Radio programs. He has also written for many national and regional publications.

results.description:
Event Host:  Grace Baptist Church of Forest Hills. Pastor Tim and Pastor Andrew.

"'For as by a man came death, by a man has come also the resurrection of the dead.  For as in Adam all die, so also in Christ shall all be made alive' (1 Corinthians 15:21-22).

Growing up. Easter meant many things to me.  I knew that I'd get a new shirt from my mom, and perhaps chocolate goodies and coins scattered across our lawn through an Easter Egg hunt.  Those traditions are fond memories, and we'll host a little Easter egg hunt for young ones on the lawn this Easter Sunday too.  But as I grew older I embraced the revolutionary message of Easter and how God's resurrection changed my life entirely forever.  Please come Sunday, March 27th and hear God's message of how this truth impacts you today.  All services are free, and are open to the public.  We invite you to stay for the Easter Egg hunt (age 3-10) and fellowship meal following the service.

*Friday, March 25th 7:00 pm-- Good Friday Service

*Sunday, March 27th 1:00 pm--Resurrection Sunday Celebration" 

Pastor Tim Richmond and Pastor Andrew Snavely

www.graceofforesthills.com

www.twitter.com/timrichmondnyc

www.guineafield.blogspot.com

results.description:
Please read Vonda McIntyre's _Dreamsnake_ , winner of the 1978 Nebula and 1979 Hugo awards. It sounds like it could be pretty trippy...
"The novel follows a healer on her quest to replace her "dreamsnake", a small snake whose venom is capable of inducing torpor and hallucinations in humans, akin to those produced by drugs such as LSD or heroin. According to the author,[3] the world is Earth, but it is in our post apocalyptic future, scientifically and socially much different from modern Earth. A nuclear war has left vast swathes of the planet too radioactive to support human life, biotechnology is far more advanced than in today's Earth—genetic manipulation of plants and animals is routine, and alternate sex patterns and other-worldly tribalism put in appearances."
results.name: March Read, Meet & Eat

results.description:
The Flamethrowers meets Let the Great World Spin in this debut novel set amid the heated conflict of Seattle's 1999 WTO protests.


On a rainy, cold day in November, young Victor--a boyish, scrappy world traveler who's run away from home--sets out to sell marijuana to the 50,000 anti-globalization protestors gathered in the streets. It quickly becomes clear that the throng determined to shut the city down--from environmentalists to teamsters to anarchists--are testing the patience of the police, and what started as a peaceful protest is threatening to erupt into violence.

Over the course of one life-altering afternoon, the lives of seven people will change forever: foremost among them police chief Bishop, the estranged father Victor hasn't seen in three years, two protestors struggling to stay true to their non-violent principles as the day descends into chaos, two police officers in the street, and the coolly elegant financial minister from Sri Lanka whose life, as well as his country's fate, hinges on getting through the angry crowd, out of jail, and to his meeting with the president of the United States.

In this raw and breathtaking novel, Yapa marries a deep rage with a deep humanity, and in doing so casts an unflinching eye on the nature and limits of compassion.
results.name: "Your Heart is a Muscle the Size of a Fist" by Sunil Yapa

results.description:
Event Info

Welcome! Come down to the brewery for good times with good people! We'll be having an open session for all Hearthstone players. This is the fifth Fireside at this location. All prior events have been a great success. When you arrive, look for the tall guy with the Hearthstone shirt. As for the brewery, they have some excellent beer for $4 a pint. Don't be afraid to ask the bartenders for samples if you're having trouble making a choice. Seating may be limited, depending on the night, but no players have had issues finding tables so far. There's plenty of standing room, three bathrooms, and you can come & go as you please. The brewery doesn't sell food, but there's a Starbucks and Wayback Burgers in walking distance, as well as McDonald's, Burger King, Wendy's, Dunkin Donuts, Popeyes , 7-Eleven, Dairy Queen , and a diner all within a half mile. Brix City doesn't mind if you bring your own food in or get food delivered.

Who's invited
21+ only. (This is a brewery) All skill levels welcome. If you're new to the game, one of us will be happy to help you.
results.name: Battle at the Brewery

Over and over and over. We are on auto pilot now, so we will have this, or another event, at a place to be determined, (TBI), every two weeks, with a pancake or some other panic event tossed in to keep everyone aggravated to the fullest.

As usual, if you RSVP 'yes' but can't make it, call me; your merry group organizer, Greg, at[masked] 1066.

And the standard 'It's ok to come late, or bring well behaved young ones' is in effect as well. 

Veggie Heaven is open till 11pm, and sometimes later(we loose track of time, someone keeps ordering scallion pancakes, and the staff is slow to tie up the evening's loose ends, so we are usually there for a good spell, I think 12AM is our record). Thus, lateness due to scheduling issues, etc, is no biggie. 

If we have a change of venue, for any given week, we will let you know in advance.

results.description:
Please join a fun and friendly group of people who are interested in playing a variety of games. Examples of games that we play include:

Word games - Word on the Street, Buzzword, Taboo, Wordie Wars, Snatch-it

Party and social games - Consensus, Apples to Apples, Dixit, Telestrations, 5 Second Rule, Awkward Family Photos,

Lighter strategy games - Ticket to Ride, Qwirkle, Carcassonne, 

Medium to heavier strategy games - Settlers of Catan, Old Dominion, Spyrium, Tzolk'in

Cooperative games - Forbidden Island, Flashpoint, Police Precinct

Card games - Parade, Station Master, Slide 5, Mill Bornes, Bohnanza,

Trivia games - Split Decision, Malarkey, Trivial Pursuit

Role playing games - Werewolf, Resistance, Avalon

Please feel free to bring your own games as well - there are always people looking to learn something new or to find a new favorite board game.

Transportation - for those who drive, there is ample parking in the Bay Terrace Shopping Center. For those who commute by bus, the Q13 and Q28 bus lines stop here. 

We encourage members to purchase food, drinks, and snacks at Panera Bread, so please refrain from bringing outside food and drinks. We want Panera to enjoy our presence!

If you're looking to play fun games with a really nice group of people, come meet up with us at Panera Bread in the Bay Terrace Shopping Center.  Newcomers are always welcome!


If you want to join our Facebook group to get the latest news on board games, hot deals on games, buying/selling games, or simply just to connect with other gamers, please join us here:

https://www.facebook.com/groups/queensboardgames/
results.how_to_find_us: We meet at Panera Bread in the Bay Terrace Shopping Center in Bayside, Queens. We convene in the Community Room.
results.name: Friday Night Boardgaming in Bayside Queens!

results.description:
Come join this wonderful on going FRIDAY EVENING co-ed (men and women) Yoga Class 7:15-8:15pm.  This is an adult yoga class for all ages and levels (if interested in children's yoga, please contact me).  Beginners are welcome and encouraged to join.  NO gym membership required.  Reiki is part of the entire class, however specifically given to each person during the quiet beginning of the class (meditation and centering) and at the end of the class during Savasana (the final pose). Each person receives Reiki during the entire class.  If you have a mat, you can bring it.  If you do not have a mat, I have some to share.  Please visit

www.CliftonYogaNJ.com

for more information or you can email through this meetup group or at [masked]. Text or call (email and text are fastest) directly (862) 621-9642.


Your first class is $10.  Future classes are sold in groups of 4 classes for $40 (still $10 per class).  NO gym membership required.  If you miss a class, you do NOT lose the class- it just stays in your account for future use :) but expires one year from purchase.  This is a wonderful class that builds upon your connection to your inner voice, connects you to your inner wisdom and divine consciousness.  You will build strength, flexibility and peace of mind... come join our group! :)
results.name: On Going FRIDAY EVENING Yoga with Reiki (both men and women are in this class)

results.description:
So some good news Dangerfield's Comedy Club the Longest running Comedy club in the world, started by Rodney Dangerfield himself 45 years ago has been generous to extend free tickets to our meetup group. This should be a fun meetup. This is not an Amateur or Gimmick Comedy show, Dangerfields features best of the best comedians who have performed in leading clubs, motion pictures and tv shows such as Tonight Show with Jay leno, Jimmy Fallon, Letterman, Seth meyers, Conan and Comedy Central. HBO's most successful comedy TV specials were taped at this club.

Im very excited to have the meetup here, We are getting tickets that are $40.00 each free for this group, its a 2 drink minimum as in any other club but if you get a drink at the bar before the show it counts toward the drink minimum which is very rare for a comedy club and theres a full food menu. If you want to just stop by have a drink and meet your fellow meetup members and not stay for the show you can do that too youll still get a ticket if you wanna use it for another time.

Hope to see you there. This weeks is hosted by Q (Quinten Heggs), Lineup includes Kyle Grooms (Comedy Central), Christian Finnegan (Comedy Central), Patty Rosborough (NBC) and more will be named.

Ive personally never been to this club, but the Organizer will have a meetup sign, we all sit together, and meet each other so look for the meetup sign and the organizer will give you the Free Tickets.

Show Starts at 8:30, so come at 7:45 to meet your fellow meetup members! Enjoy!
results.name: Dangerfields Friday Night Comedy Meetup - Free Tickets for this group!

REGISTER HERE


Aligning to Truth: A Channeled Workshop in NYC

Award-winning author and channel Paul Selig will lead a new, deeply transformational, channeled workshop where you will work directly with his guides to achieve new levels of healing, self-awareness and life purpose.

Through lectures, attunements, Q&A and energy work, Paul and his Guides will lead you through their program for personal conscious transformation.

Advance tickets are available for $40 until March 11. Tickets are $50 thereafter.

ABOUT PAUL SELIG

Paul Selig is a writer, empath and conscious channel. In his breakthrough works of channeled literature, I Am the Word, The Book of Love and Creation, The Book of Knowing and Worth, and The Book of Mastery, he recorded an extraordinary program for personal and planetary evolution as humankind awakens to its own divine nature. Paul has led channeled energy groups for nearly 20 years and maintains a private practice as a psychic in New York City. Paul’s recent and upcoming workshops include the Esalen Institute, the Omega Institute and the Kripalu Center, and he has been featured on the documentary series The uneXplained on the A&E/BIO channel.

For questions about the workshop, please email [masked] or call 212.941.9390.

results.description:
The third of four films in our series is Spike Lee's Do The Right Thing from 1989.

Spike Lee is one of Americas greatest film makers and has made what is probably the most consistently provocative, entertaining, funny, honest and racially charged set of movies of any American director.

Do The Right Thing tells the story of one block (and particularly one white owned pizza parlor, Sal's) in Bedford-Stuyvesant on a very hot summer's day that doesn't end well.  Lee hits every racial button from every angle, his "stereotypes" aren't simple and the movie avoids pat answers. No one - and no race - gets a pass in this movie. There are no simple answers.

Do The Right Thing was very controversial when it came out and was met with high praise and intense criticism. Nevertheless it is now widely considered one of the greatest movies of the 80s and in 1999 was deemd to be "culturally significant" by the Library of Congress. Naturally, if failed to win even a single Oscar despite stellar performances by Danny Aiello, Ossie Davis, Ruby Dee, Rosie Perez, John Turturo, Samuel L. Jackson and others! 

$5 suggested donation at the door

Discussion will follow

Light snacks included

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, time it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no 

displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds: Cancel your RSVP ,  24 hours or more before the game and we will make the refund. No refund for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

The school entrance is located on East 109th street between 2nd and 3rd avenues (near 2nd avenue) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right) and someone will open the door for you.

For questions,  use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
Introduction to EFT – Emotional Freedom Techniques – Energy Tapping With Dr. Jay Kantor.

EFT – Emotional Freedom Techniques – is the breakthrough healing technique of our times.  It is a form of Energy Psychology, based on the insight that disturbing emotions are actually energy imbalances in the body. Body energies become imbalanced when we think thoughts that we judge as unacceptable.

Our emotional reactions to specific thoughts can be neutralized by balancing the energies of the body-mind, while thinking those thoughts. Energy balance is initiated by gently tapping on specific points on the body. These points are the same points treated in the Chinese medical practice of acupuncture.

Tonight we will have a thorough introduction to EFT by its founder Gary Craig, with commentaries by healing pioneers Louise Hay and Wayne Dyer.  We will also view EFT case histories that demonstrate the successful use of EFT for a wide variety of body-mind problems.

EFT is the best emotional/psychological survival technique of our times.  If you suffer from any body-mind difficulties, you owe it to yourself to check out EFT.  I hope you can join us at Panera.  We start at 7:30PM.

For more information on EFT go to : http://EFTNJ.Com .

For more information on the organizer go to : http://DrJayKantor.Com .

For an article on Energy Psychology go to : http://EnergyPsychology.US .
results.name: Intro. to EFT – Emotional Freedom Techniques – Energy Tapping W/ Dr. Jay Kantor

results.description:
Please join the Unitarian Universalist Congregation of the Palisades (UUCP) for a screening of the EMMY® Award-Winning Film for Best Documentary, “Journey of the Universe.” 

Acclaimed author and evolutionary philosopher Brian Thomas Swimme talks about our role as humans in this awe-inspiring universe, and his insights will light up the night skies. As the host, co-writer, and fellow traveler, he shares his infectious curiosity about life’s biggest questions in the epic JOURNEY OF THE UNIVERSE.

Using his skills as a masterful storyteller, Swimme connects such big picture issues as the birth of the cosmos 14 billion years ago – to the invisible frontiers of the human genome – as well as to our current impact on Earth’s evolutionary dynamics. Through his engaging and thoughtful observations audiences everywhere will discover the profound role we play in this intricate web of life.

From the Big Bang to the epic impact humans have on the planet today, this film is designed to inspire a new and closer relationship with Earth in a period of growing environmental and social crisis.

Bring a friend and stay for a discussion after the film and light refreshments. We look forward to seeing you!
results.name: JOURNEY OF THE UNIVERSE: An Epic Story of Cosmic, Earth, & Human Transformation

group.name: Unitarian Universalist Congregation of the Palisades

We normally meet EVERY 2ND AND 4TH FRIDAY

              (whether it's dinner or just dessert/drinks)

In addition, (after an initial round of “Scrabble”) THE 4TH WEEK OF EVERY MONTH, we enjoy TEAM TRIVIA, pitting two teams of those who want to play against each other in a battle of wits over totally insignificant information.

(Those who are not trivia aficionados continue their Scrabble competition.)

Afterward, for those who want to hang and chill, we play a short group game, chosen at random. (TABOO has been the latest "hot choice.")

ABOVE ALL, WE HAVE ONE HOUSE RULE—

                          LET FUN BE #1!!!

results.description:
Brazilian movie night is back!


I suggest you to get your ticket in advance. CinemaTropical is offering a $4.00 discount to our group! To redeem: Click on "Schedule" and select Neon Bull on 3/25 at 9pm. Enter promo code NDNF2016 (case-sensitive) in the upper right corner. Buy now at<a> newdirectors.org</a>.


There will be a Boi Neon cocktail before the movie, but only for those who RSVP by 3/24. I will not be able to add more names to the cocktail after that. We will meet at 8pm in the room off the lobby, next to the theater.


I hope to see you there!

Aparecida Teixeira


A rodeo movie unlike any other, Gabriel Mascaro’s Venice and Toronto prize-winning tracks handsome cowboy Iremar (Juliano Cazarré) as he travels around to work at vaquejada  rodeos, a Brazilian variation on the sport in which two men on horseback attempt to bring a bull down by its tail. Iremar dreams of becoming a fashion designer, creating flamboyant outfits for his co-worker, single mother Galega (Maeve Jinkings). Along with Galega’s daughter Cacá and a bullpen worker named Zé, these complex characters, drawn with tremendous compassion and not an ounce of condescension, make up an unorthodox family, on the move across the northeast Brazilian countryside. Sensitive to matters of gender and class, and culminating in one of the most audacious and memorable sex scenes in recent memory, Neon Bull is a quietly affirming exploration of desire and labor, a humane and sensual study of bodies at work and at play.


Directed By Gabriel Mascaro, 2015, Brazil/Uruguay/Netherlands, Portuguese with English subtitles, 101 minutes.

See the trailer: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=o0Tt_HuOfXY
results.name: Brazilian movie night - Neon Bull (Boi Neon)

results.description:
This week we are going to give Everyday Gourmet another shot.  Come on in and find us on the second floor.  

Gotham Atheists weekly Drinking With Atheists Friday Night Socials!

Join us for a great night of conversation in relaxed company in New York City. We go from 8pm to around 11pm or so.

Every Friday Night for 8 years we have gathered to enjoy the evening and the company of each other. Every week we meet at someone's apartment, a park, or a bar. DWA (Drinking With Atheists) is for Atheists, agnostics, Skeptics, Philosophers, Humanists, Freethinkers, Brights, secularists, inquiring minds, and all around nice people. No agenda but good light conversations. Great chance to meet new people and make new friends.

See you Friday Night.

Lee

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs (the roster shows 11 spots only because it includes the organizer who will play if needed). One game is 55-60 minutes. Please come a little early so that we all can start on time and play 1 solid hour. Goal keeper rotation every 5-6 minutes. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt (if you don't have red, a solid dark will do), indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence.

more info at [masked]

Thank you,

Jaime Arias

results.description:
New to Blues dancing? Check out our FAQ. 


If you've never been to Friday Night Blues NYC before, it's a great idea to check out our policies on Blues etiquette and on harassment before coming.


****************************************************************************

SCHEDULE:

8:15pm-8:29pm - Class Check-in
8:30pm-9:30pm - Fundamentals Lesson (Rhythmic Variations) w/ Shoshi and Shira
8:30pm-9:30pm - Extended Topics (Creative Musicality) w/ Odysseus and Jeanette
9:30pm-10:00pm - DJ Flouer
10:00pm-11:00pm - LIVE MUSIC!! w/ Big Frank and the Healers
11:00pm-11:30pm - DJ Flouer
11:30pm-12:30am - Big Frank and the Healers
12:30am-1:30am - DJ Flouer


$10 class / $16 dance / $24 both 
Cash only 


(If you use a punch card, you will be asked for an additional $4 to help cover the cost of the band.)


****************************************************************************


MARCH EXTENDED TOPICS:


Series This Month: Creative Musicality
There are dance moves, there are recognizable chord structures, but how do you know what goes where in your dance? Should you be dancing in breakaway with large, powerful moves? Or in close embrace, with small, subtle movement? This series, besides just exploring your creative side of dancing, is to get you to start training your ears to truly listen to the music and all of its components. Join us for an entire month exploring different types of blues music and how to use the music to inform your musical choices.


This Week: Outside the Box
Explore blues adjacent music, music that is not truly blues but has blues elements.  Learn how to identify these blues elements and how to apply your blues training to dance to it.

Read more about our classes at: http://www.fridaynightblues.nyc/learning

****************************************************************************

DETAILS:

No need to bring a partner! Friday Night Blues NYC is a social dance; we dance with strangers, we dance with our friends... we want to dance with you! Our crowd can typically bring in anywhere from 80 to 100+ dancers on any given evening.

The lesson costs $10, and the dance is $16 (sorry, cash only). Purchase both at the same time and pay only $24 for the night!

****************************************************************************

Volunteers get in for FREE!
Email [masked] to inquire about volunteer opportunities.

Stay informed: join our mailing list!

Friday Night Blues NYC is on Yelp! If you enjoy our event, please consider leaving us a review.

results.description:
This TurnON is not cancelled and still happening!!!

Come and join us for an evening of fun and TurnOn. How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in NYC?

We play 3 communication game (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). Imagine meeting new people in an environment where people felt comfortable to be themselves. That's what we have created.

It's a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation.

You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can have the life that you want.

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. In an hour and some you may even forget for a moment you are in New York City.

OneTaste NYC is an organization teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at TurnON are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!).

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

Come early, doors close at 8:40p. COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

For questions contact [masked] |[masked]


Can't make this one? Visit us at www.turnonny.us
results.name: TurnONGames@UpperWestSide STILL HAPPENING TONIGHT!

results.description:
Q&A WITH DIRECTOR JULIO HERNÁNDEZ CORDÓN

MeetUp Members save $4 on tickets -

Enter promo codeNDNF2016 (case-sensitive) in the upper right corner.

http://purchase.filmlinc.org/single/SelectSeating.aspx?p=30752&tnewq=630b529d-5d33-451c-a17b-20f8c99e66a8&tnewp=fa992b19-989e-491d-890b-959d3292e6a4&tnewts=1458660167&tnewc=filmlinc&tnewe=yearround&tnewrt=Safetynet&tnewh=69c853e14138a99628650c593b526703

Miguel (Diego Calva) and Johnny (Eduardo Eliseo Martinez) are in deep. Badass skater-bros, crazy-in-love blood hustlers, they’re flowing inevitably toward a sea swimming with narco-sharks. This is Mexico City today, and for two boys from different worlds but the same house—Johnny is the son of Miguel’s family maid—there is no future. On the days they do have at their disposal, they will live as hard as they can, even if it means total destruction for everyone around them. A harrowing vision of the 21st century replete with garishly lit sex scenes, inebriated slow motion, and an exhilarating, eclectic pop soundtrack, and winner of numerous prizes at festivals in Latin America, Julio Hernández Cordón’s film is exploding with beats, sweat, and pain—an ecstatic and anguished portrait of youth teetering on the brink of nihilism.

results.description:
Let's dance, let's practice, and let's meet and greet at La Fama; New York City's all new Salsa Dance Party in the heart of Manhattan's Time Square. 


We are here every Friday night from 9:30pm to 3am. If you're tired of being in a night club setting that plays more Reggaeton and Bachata then actual Salsa, then this event is for you.  We are located very conveniently in the Center of Manhattan.  Every Train/Bus stops here.  There is also no night club/bar/lounge hassle to deal with. 


A beautiful dance floor and great sound system with out the pesky hassle of a night club.  Dress as you like and feel free to bring your own drinks. 

Also, For those who like a beginner introductory Salsa class and those who want to dance after the class. The Free beginner class at 9:30pm, after admission is also on. 

Admission: $10 to get in (which includes a free Salsa Lesson). The Introductory class for beginners is given at no extra charge by the instructor. Note that this will be your only expense for the entire Friday night unless you buy a beverage. But you can also bring your own beverages if you want.

Time: The event starts at 9:30pm and ends at 3:00am or until the last dancers leave. Come at any time.

Location: Times Square 151 West 46th Street, 11th Floor, New York, NY 10036 (between 7av and 6av)

Dress code: Casual/comfortable. Bring shoes that don't slip out of your feet and do not have too much grip on the floor.

Class: The Free class (after admission) at La Fama begins at 9:30pm and teaches you the basic step every Friday. If you like to take a formal Salsa dancing class that goes beyond the basics A new 12 weeks cycle will begin on February 18th. For details, join the facebook group and/or join the Class meetup group. Links below:

https://www.facebook.com/groups/453057848231239/

http://www.meetup.com/Progressive-Salsa-Classes/events/228266520/
results.name: Salsa Dancing Party in NYC

group.name: Salsa Dance Party in Times Square Manhattan

results.description:
https://scontent-lga3-1.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-xtp1/v/t1.0-9/11401142_1720823001478478_3682666258495805787_n.jpg?oh=6d3a52147bbb4787f69b1b492b283ec2&oe=56D0E6E4

Every Friday Night!
Salsa Dancing in Times Square is Back!
LA FAMA (151 W 46th St, 11th Floor) is a Latin Party that specializes in playing and dancing to Salsa Music. The event takes place where the bright lights are. That's right, Times Square. We have a nice floor, great ventilation, fun willing dancers, and your total expense for a Friday Night is 12.00

Mention Salsa New York at the door and it will be $10


You do not know how to Dance Salsa? No problem. We offer a Free Salsa class at 9:30pm every Friday. So come alone or bring your friends,. Either way, you are guaranteed to learn and have a blast.
You know what else is back? The music. LA FAMA is bringing the music back to the forefront. That's Right, DJ Mustachio will be in th building playing foot stomping flavorful Salsa songs to get those hips moving and grooving.

Karaoke is fun! Every other week, let's all meet up in Elmsford, and let loose with some singing!

Karaoke starts at 10:00. Some of us also meet up at 8:30 for dinner beforehand.

There is free valet parking, and when the valet guy leaves, he parks your car very close by (as parking becomes more available) and gives you back your keys. Street parking is also readily available.

***This is the same location- just out the back doors under the lights! Beautiful turf field provides for some beautiful soccer.  Full field - back up to 22 players!!

Join Friday nights intermediate/advanced players for some seriously fun, face-paced soccer under the lights at Hofstra University.   These games will be played on beautiful turf fields and are indoor/outdoor, depending on the season.  

Summer= Outside

Fall/Winter= Indoor

These games start promptly at 10:30 pm, please be on time or your spot may be given away to the walk-ons that do show up. 

The fee for this game is $15.00 which covers the cost of the field which you must pay even if you no show.  The field is expensive and the Club goes out of pocket for you if you do not show up! 

RSVP Rules apply!  Update cut off is 4:00 pm Friday.
